Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Assuming "Albucasim" is a misinterpretation or corruption of an actual medieval term (perhaps relating to leeches, given
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	Assuredly," began the master to his students as he unfolded this revered medical manuscript—the culmination of lifetimes dedicated not just in study but also practice and innovation within their field—and expressed that through years spent honing one's craft, both at work and scholarship (through essays or lectures) have led to the creation they now present. To these students he was most pleased, for this tome is a fragment from his larger surgical works; thus revealing not just knowledge but applied skill—akin to leechcraft—their efforts are appreciated as having succeeded in bringing forth something valuable and insightful on behalf of all seekers after medical wisdom.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	The work of our master is laid prostrate in every corner of our realm and era, not just due to the skill he's known throughout all his years but also because we have observed this art anew; thus altering some minor depictions found within these ancient texts. Whereas other works may remain untouched by leechcraft except for a few scattered illustrations in those books of antiquity, and where errors along with hastiness are expanded upon while the force is lengthened—reflective not only of our master's own perspective but also his intention to enlighten.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	It is seen by me that this treatise breathes life into the ordered principles I have set out here through essayistic expositions and declarations; and for completing such descriptions of cautery tools (and others) included in the work—which are not merely add-ons but integral to articulating my point. This inclusion is necessary as a preparatory measure.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	May be the reason why not all artisans abandon their tools at work is that medicine takes a long time in our era, and it requires its practitioner to exercise now in anatomical science which Gálynna recorded inside she knew how members functioned and their shapes. This includes understanding joints' conjunction (connection) and separation of them; the knowledge of bones, nerves, muscles, as well as the number of these parts; pulse veins and quiet ones without beating, also where they reside in the body or what is inside it - organs. And about their blood flow rhythms (pulses), resting states when there'th no beatings, and locations within the body for all this to happen.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	For that reason I name myself (Ypocras), even in the work and most especially in arts such as medicine.  
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	We already have told you about that which we say concerning him in the beginning of this book; whoever does not know what I said regarding anatomy has no guarantee to avoid falling into error, as even some dead bodies used for certain purposes are shaped according to these studies and practices.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	I saw a doctor with expertise in scorbut who has inscribed an apoplexy mark on the neck of a woman, and made marks some arteries around to ensure that much blood flow into her so she could die quickly among others like this one found by many people.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I saw another doctor who only prescribed a piece of stone from a man'dead in his state; the stone was big and brought to life here for some time and then removed by this measure taken at once, so that such a person died on the third day after being struck.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And I had already called to remove that stone and saw it was because of the size of the rock and positioning of the malady underneath such that she would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And I saw another doctor who received payment from one of our land's dukes to perform surgery; and even had the skull cracked in person due to its blackness underneath here as an experiment, exploiting his ignorance by breaking the fracture on top where there were weak bones like these.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	E prese the splinter as he wishes, and secure it with bandages, and let him rest on cool nights and command that we pull out his ligament; this is how they stay inside until their joint comes loose from its socket, thus causing damage or destruction (perdicio).
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And you appealed to him and equipped with tools for removing the ligament, once peace was achieved through treatment methods such as massage therapy or medication, reducing his pain symptoms (dolors).
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	However, despite the treatment, infection was confirmed in his member (limb), and therefore we could not prevent that from occurrenering again before another evil (morbidity) invaded him through a wound or similar condition to cause additional harm.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And another physician cut off the cancerous abscess and opened it to treat other parts of his body that day until inflamed pain became clear evidence (foc) he had lost control or ownership over himself, as if showing submission to a higher power. This suggests an esoteric belief in divine intervention during times when earthly medicine fails—the 'senhor' being the savior figure representing this entity who can alleviate suffering even beyond human capabilities.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	This causes the head to be in pain due to melancholic humors that have entered it; even if he were able to find relief for everything else through treatments like cautery or medication, there is no treatment capable of relieving him from this particular suffering (member) where his illness has taken hold. This illustrates a misunderstanding in medieval medical practice about the nature and localization of pain—believing it can be treated holistically when often specific issues require individualized attention.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	Per aquí, children, it is necessary for you that the operation be designed in two ways: firstly, an operation associated with health (salut), and secondly, a risky procedure (pericolosa) due to major circumstances or complications.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	Even you have been exposed to this book in which both opposition and errors occur; therefore it is necessary for you that guard yourselves against the water contained within these pages and utilize it so as not to harm folks through speech or deceitfulness. (Meaning: Even though there are oppositions and mistakes found throughout this text, I implore you all to be cautious of its content which contains potentially misleading information about using hot spring water for medical purposes.)
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And take up your arms at supplication and for protection from God, and let your illness go away and be stopped.

Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	It begins to write about everything freely.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	The cover that says: what the quality of those limbs are after this treatment and who is not allowed to undergo such procedures in which context it's forbidden.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	So I say that the speech about the quality of those limbs after this treatment and who is not allowed to undergo such procedures in which context it' endangered; It was a long and complex language for science and secretly painful work, highly praised by many people but often disagreed with me. E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And I say that cuters are performed for the complete treatment of all parts and materials related thereto; Except two complexes which refer to tailing these same materials.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the complex case of a dry and dehydrated body matter being separated; some dyssery that heals with this substance is done, while others are not suitable for such treatment due to its nature concerning quality and aridity which makes it unsuitable. The cause also has similar qualities in terms of both quantity and dryness - therefore a cautery operation suited towards treating dehydration that removes this substance from the affected area is most appropriate as well-being for such condition lies not only within but beyond physical treatment itself, suggesting an allusion to humoral medicine's spiritual aspect.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	Edis the one who says against that person, which by cauterization he treats very well in all maladies of tail and dryness seen on men' end bodies; whenever you compare a man's body to those humidities around it at the center of focus, your own eyes betray this sickly condition.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	You say in that speech of his who has already discovered some water for me.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	But a wise man who comes upon that which has already been expropriated and exercised in the capital of cauterization for surgery may understand: he knows about the diversity of human complexity and disease disposition within their bodies, its causes, and accidents associated with it. He also appreciates the time span of these ailments.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	Might also exist in other complexities, and is not necessarily about your fear; it mainly concerns with humoral excesses that are cold and wet, which all physicians agree upon regarding treatment using caustic substances without concern for the amount of medicine used to cauterize.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	Sage that the secret of healing for caustics applied to focus and on how much good it brings, is simple; only those who are treated with such medicine experience its effects without harming any other part except for what has been targeted by treatment (the foot in this case) which suffers a minor inconvenience compared to the rest of the body.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	The medicine causing cauterization reaches the body part that has no healing and is difficult to treat (the foot), and it comes in with ease, making its arrival swiftly through veins or arteries without difficulty of passage as if coming directly from them due to their open state.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	The focus' sublimation and its humoral content do not cause water to flow in but have been known to us through experiments and a long period of study about the truth of causes; therefore it is excused from lengthy speech because of this (about how caustic treatment directly affects only targeted parts). Hence, at least until now, I am free during these pauses for my secret thoughts on love' endangered by its absence in his heart. The philosophical demonstration that the operations performed on our bodies and expelling diseases through which are removed illnesses can be understood as a dialogue of philosophy presented to your leisurely evenings, I would argue it could enrich them if you read about such matters (if one were so inclined).
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	Sage children who disagree with the time at which it is best to perform punctures and intervals between them in their first morning, wise healers say that they should do so when most appropriate for each individual case during treatment sessions on Mondays starting from Monday of Lent. E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	It is said that caustic treatments are appropriate at any time because the document for such treatment should be submerged in water to which heat has been applied; this happens mostly when treating pain or necessary procedures, mainly if they're done with fine instruments like needles. E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	Thus they do not drink water in their sickbeds or children because it is regarded as the vulgar and ignorant poor folk of healers who prefer that which should be addressed by caustic treatment before being dismissed with distractions, leading to unresolved consequences.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	The cause is not relieved by water that healers look after for, because caustic treatment does not just involve the medicine but also changes complexity and dries out moisture layers which are sources of pain. Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor. E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	It is possible that his illness may return at any time due to the complexity of the malady and its location in relation to their worth and work contributions; however, if the illness treated with caustics or milder treatments for minor fluxes and humidities affecting a few parts (possibly referring here metaphorically), as long as these are removed from his body through food by means of ingestion during meals in order to avoid this pain. This suggests that not only should one be cautious with the treatment itself, but also ensure proper dietary habits and environmental conditions can prevent recurrence or worsening of illnesses like gout which might manifest as acute joint inflammation due to uric acid accumulation in the bloodstream.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	Perhaps the vulgar saying that caustic treatment is often misused in medicine; and perhaps it's also true wisdom, not just about what we hear but learn from experience as well - these are treatments I think many patients consider to lack proper care or healing outside of medicine itself. This statement highlights a distrust towards traditional medical practices that rely on caustics (potentially referring here metaphorically) and emphasizes the importance of understanding true healthcare beyond just medicinal interventions, suggesting holistic approaches may be more beneficial in managing conditions like gout which is often treated with alkaline solutions to neutralize acidic uric acids.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the cause is contrary to water; and it was understood that by applying caustics of medicine in some diseases we only get benefits when treating their causes with hydrotherapy (water therapy), which provides healing effects related to its source, as well as other medicinal properties not mentioned.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And here are the additional details about applying caustics of medicine: according to this understanding, which I interpret as commonly held beliefs and practices among some doctors' circles.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	Doctors do not want the ancient methods of caustic treatments to be better than those with iron because it's due to their equality and the purity of its substance. De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Line by line translation into English:
Le capitol primier.	The chief physician spoke first.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	The chief physician spoke first about this cautionary treatment that relates to the balance of humidity and coldness on accident causes which are caused by salt and various types of fluids in a rheumatic flow, from head to toe parts of hips and legs as well as excessive sleepiness, pain in teeth and jaws, universally due to all illnesses that suffer frostbite or similar conditions.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	 The form of this cautionary treatment is thus: initially, you command the evil spirit to be expelled through medicine-based water remedies on Mondays, for three or four nights in a row as long as it requires and depends on the patient's disposition and age.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And he commands that the evil race be driven out of his head with sharp instruments and uses pointed surgical tools between your most private areas on a lowered bed, holding them over their chest to prevent it from coming out. This is an interpretation based on medieval texts often mixing natural philosophy with spiritual beliefs about disease causation and treatment; modern medical science does not recognize evil spirits as causes or treatments for illnesses like gout.

De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	Of cauterization of an abscess in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat. Cauterization of the gum border is done by taking cow dung paste and rubbing it on the borders (using a straw), then applying cotton thread to cover that area, wrapping another bandage around part of the wound where this treatment has been applied until there's evidence of cauterization. ✅ This aligns with historical medical protocol in treating dental afflictions through direct application and subsequent dressing methods; such meticulous care was crucial for promoting healing while preventing further invasion by pathogens or foreign objects, reflecting an early understanding of wound management even though the treatments used today are more advanced.

E le loc de la dislocacio es atrobat en lu quays boyt.	The location of the dislocation is attacked in such way that it hurts bones and flesh alike.

When pus-forming ulcers are found in the body of an ill person caused by hard and corrupt materials inside, doctors performed a trepurchase to remove these impurities completely from each wound, either directly on top with small thorns; or over long periods as part of exorcism rituals (erestologia); or through slow focusing light beams onto the lesion. This procedure was based on medieval medical belief that bodily ailments could stem from spiritual disturbans and physical impurities, hence combining both religious practices with rudimentary surgical techniques to restore health by cleansing these 'evils' from the body. These trepurchase methods were part of broader healing rites where prayer, herbs, and symbolic gestures like bloodletting or leech therapy intermingled as complementary treatments for various maladies during that era.

E de aquels es le qual dona a tu son aver e ditta, tu esperant am aquel sanetat, e la sieua malautia es perniciosa.	This passage reflects the deeply rooted belief that health and well-being were seen as indicators of divine favor or displeasure in medieval Europe, where religious faith often intertwined with daily life. Disease was commonly interpreted not just as a physical condition but also an omen connected to moral standing before God; thus implying that illness could be both physically detrimental

This reflects a society where education might not have widely reached yet common sense dictated restraint from harmful practices and the quest for understanding through accepted methods of inquiry despite potential social pressures or traditional beliefs opposing this viewpoint. Exsicca tot le sanc am espongua o am drap secc e aprop repleys entre las doas labias de la fissura am coto vielh o am draps de li. E aprop estrenh desus am polvils enbegutz en vi e oli per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And if you want to introduce new bile into its path and ensure it passes through the veins, then do this in order that there may be an apoplectic attack at the end of treatment.
E quan deslias aquo e veses que l’apostema ja es diminuit, lahoras cove que fregua le os entro que comensa en lu nayser carn, e aprop cura aquel am regiment exsiccatiu le qual fassa neysser la carn, ayssi cum si tu prenes de farina de froment dos partidas e de colofania quatre partidas e mescla o, e de lor sia fayt emplastre e sia aministrat en aquestas plaguas a de la carn nativitat. De la cura de aquo que catz en las aurelhas.	From water that flows in the arteries, we derive healing potions. The essence extracted during our time must be captured to prepare these elixirs of
Tota causa que catz en las aurelhas es una de quatre specias, quar o es peyra mineral o causa semblant a peyra, ayssi cum ferr e veyre, o es de planta ayssi cum ceze o fava, o es causa fluxtibla ayssi cum aygua e vi agre e a lor semblantz, o alcuna bestia.	The water flowing in the arteries is one of four species; it could be mineral water or seem like rocks when combined with iron and glassware, or have fluid properties similar to herbs mixed with broth that agree with their nature, or perhaps some animal cause by association. Each type holds distinct medicinal qualities essential for healing practices during the Middle Ages.
E donc quan peyra catz en l’aurelha o autra causa semblant de aquelas causas que no ajustan ne creysso en l’aurelha, e pausa la aurelha al solelh, e si vezes la peyra, lahoras distilla en aquela alcuna causa de oli violat o sizami, e aprop aministra la extraccio de lu, e fay le stornudar am condizi, e oppila las nars deve le aveniment de stornutacio.	Whenever rock is found in the artery or other causes resembling those that don't naturally belong to it and are placed within its flow, cease allowing water through this vessel into sunlight; sometimes we observe such rocks directly at these locations where distillation yields olive oil or sizami. We extract from here a certain cause of medicinal essence, and administer the withdrawal process with care for stornuttacio restoration, while simultaneously pruning nettles to mitigate discomfort caused by its treatment. This passage suggests that specific substances derived from minerals found in arteries are used as healing agents through various methods like distillation and extraction during the medieval period. It also highlights traditional practices for managing side effects of such treatments, indicating an intricate knowledge of medicinal plants' properties and preparation techniques to both remedy illnesses and alleviate symptoms caused by natural elements found within patients’ bodies at that time in history.
E aprop pausa en le circuit de la aurelha alscunas pessas de drap o lana, e dextendas la aurelha a las partidas desus, quar motas veguadas es foro-getada am aquestas causas. E si no n’es getada, lahoras aministra extraccio de lu am le instrument apelat gesti epicicarios subtil del qual aquesta es la forma:	If not applied pressure, then administer extraction using the specific tool referred to here as its gentle form for effective treatment.
E si es foro-getada am gesti, bo es; e sino, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am onci subtil de pauca duplicacio.	If the technique is applied as per instruction, then proceed accordingly (apply pressure); otherwise, administer extraction using a gentle tool with only minimal repetition for effectiveness. (This refers to applying manual therapy techniques or acupuncture if not applicable.)

Therefore, if not applied manually (through touch), then perform an injection of aram and insert the tip into the extremity of the arm through which blood circulates to ensure that nothing else extrudes from there except for the needle covered in soothing substances such as wax or oil.

Capitol .vii.	Capitulum VII.
De curacio de opilacio de aurelhas.	Chapter VII on treatment for joints' pain.
Alcunas veguadas alcus enfantz yeysso dels ventres de lors mayres no-perforatz, e aquo ja accideys en alcus homes, opilacio en le meat de la aurelha per plagua o per carn nada en aquela; e aquesta opilacio alcunas veguadas es fayta en le preon del trau de la aurelha la qual no consiec le vezement, e alcunas veguadas es en las partidas defora.	At times children' extrusion of the contents of their belly is not perforating and pain in some sick adults occurs similarly; this expulsion happens sometimes through the skin over the joint (without any visible inflammation), or even inside it, as well as outside on certain occasions.
E aquela que accideys en le preon de lu, la qual no comprehen le vezement, es en las majors disposicios de dificil sanacio.	And the one that hurts in the area of your hand (which does not heal), is found mainly among those difficult to cure situations.
E en aquela en qual consegueys le vezement, cove que tu pauses la aurelha del malaute al solelh e reguarda en aquela.	And in that case where you can perform the amputation, stop and observe your joints' malady (patella). The key is to halt its development by keeping both knees straightened out on either side of one another at eye level while observing it directly. This approach helps avoid unnecessary movements or shifts which could worsen pain symptoms.
E donc si vezes oppulacio apparent, obre aquela am espatum subtil del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And sometimes you must bear that subtle form of suffering underneath the obvious one - this way it becomes part of your being. E apply pressure on the bandage over his arm for as long as I have applied an Egyptian embalming substance wrapped around him in such quantity that it completely covers my clothed limb which has now taken shape; thus, healing begins to take place inside while you are secure of this process. If you find that his wound is already healed and secured by nature (as evidenced by the hardness of its bandage), then simply remove the outer wrapping made from aromatic wood or stone which has now become too tight; once done, ensure proper care afterwards for recovery while avoiding any source of infection.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras submergeys esponga o drap en aygua frega e pausa sobre la aurelha, e usa del autra curacio la qual restrengeys le flux del sanc, la qual es dita en le tractat de distillacio. Donc fen sobre aquela am fissura per la latitut, e aprop escorga aquela de tota partida am facilitat entro que evasesca, e aprop suspen aquela am onci e abscindeys aquela. Mays si a tu no es apparelhada la incizio de lu si no pus que penetras la palpebra am inscizio pauc a pauc, lahoras aquo no notz en deguna causa. E si es pauca, a tu no sobrevindra mal per aquela quar l’anguent de lu restaura aquela e encarna.	And if there is little then you shall not suffer for the last anguish of it - which will heal and bring back to life that part affected by cold humors (gout).
E si la grandissia es declinant a las partidas dedintz de la palpebra deves la superficia dedintz, lahoras evesa la palpebra e suspen la grandissia am onci, otra que tu indigescas de incizio, e prem aquela de tota part, e si la palpebra per inscizio es alonguada, aquo no notz en deguna causa. De restauracio de dentz maugudas am fiel de aur o de argent.	The restoration of old or new teeth from gold or silver requires careful treatment to ensure proper alignment and fit within the mouth, as well as appropriate care for both materials' compatibility with human tissue.
Quan accideys a las dentz devant concussio e remossio per percussio o per cazament, e le malaute no pot strenher sobre aquo que manga, e tu has curat aquel am medicinas stipticas, e no ha valgut la tua curacio, lahoras per so que no cagan es engen en aquelas que sian strengudas am fiel de aur e no de argent, quar argent se fa vert e aprop se poyreys aprop alscus dias, mays aur nul temps no es mudat.	When teeth are subjected to concussion and loosening through percussion or extraction, the patient cannot hold back tears from their hand as they receive stitch-like treatments based on medicine; however, your treatment has not been effective for healing in those cases that have become fixed with gold fillings but were originally silver. Silver dissolves easily into other substances and can be reused after a few days to secure the filling metal back onto teeth if they are made of precious metals like gold or platinum, which do not change over time.
E sia le fiel en tal subtilitat e grocesa segon la quantitat que puesca entrar entre las dentz; e la forma de la reccio es que prenguas le fiel e pren lo doble de lu entre doas dentz sanas, e aprop que cresques am doas tortuositatz del fiel entre doas maugudas, o si’ una o motas, entro que pervengua la tela a la dent sana del autra partida.	Regard for the subtle and delicate placement of fillings according to how much can fit between the teeth; in terms of repairing or replacing them when they come out, you take one piece of metal (filling), bend it twice around two healthy adjacent front teeth on both sides. Then grow a curved filling wire from either side' end towards the other broken molar tooth so that through this tape-like method used for repair and alignment, all parts come together at some point along one of these straightened ends in order to rejoin with another healthy part without leaving any gaps.
E aprop itera le teyssiment entro a la partida de la qual comenciest, e strenh la tua ma am facilitat e savieza entro que no sia mauguda.	E apply pressure on the poultice within the affected area and use your hand firmly but gently to avoid causing discomfort.
E sia la tua striccio am la qual strenhas le fiel deves las razitz de las dentz que no evasesca.	It is your scab that you should hold onto so as not to lose any of its teeth, which are the remnants of healing.
E aprop inscindeys las extramitatz del fiel superfluens am las forceps o tosoyras, e agregua aquelas en quascun loc am gesti, e converteys aquelas e las occulta entre la dent sana e la dent mauguda, per so que no fassa lesio a la lengua.	E insinuate the excess mites on top of hair using forceps or toothpicks and place them in any part where it should be applied; introduce those same into healthy teeth as well as cavities, concealing their presence so that they do not harm tongue tissue.
E aprop leyssa aquela ayssi streyta cum roman.	And lay them with the patient on bed rest for Rome's approach.
Mays si es desliada o rumpuda, strenh aquela o aquelas am autra fiel en tal manieyra en tot son temps.	May it be loose or pregnant; otherwise apply that same feather back and forth at all times.
E aquesta es la forma de las dentz e la figura de la rectacio de doas dentz sanas e de doas maugudas, ayssi cum vezes aquestas liadas:	This is the shape of healthy and diseased teeth as well; sometimes these are bound together like this. (Note that "liada" seems to be a misspelling or misuse in context—it should likely read "bound," which means tied, but it appears here possibly due to an error when transcribing from the original source.)
E quan se fa que retorno una dent o doas aprop le cazement de quascuna en lors locs, e sian recrescutz ayssi cum havem recomtat, e que remauguan.	When we find that the filling of one or several teeth needs to be returned due to their occurrence in certain locations and they grow again after having been placed by us, these are restored with resin-composite fillings as well, which continue to wear down over time (again likely a transcription error for "wear").
E no fa aquo sino bo artifexs e savi.	And it's not by the skill of mere tools and instruments that this is accomplished. (This implies there may be other factors at play, possibly implying
E alcunas veguadas es aptat alcuna causa dels osses de vaca, e es fayt de lor ayssi cum forma de dent, e es pausada en loc en le qual defayl la dent, e es strengit ayssi cum havem dit, e reman e serveys am aquel per lonc temps.	At times the bones of cows are apt for certain causes affecting their teeth; these should be crafted into a form resembling human dentures and placed in the position where the tooth has fallen out, being bound as we have mentioned previously (with care not causing further harm), remaining firmly attached by that person over long periods. This suggests a medieval understanding of prosthetics or temporary fillings for missing teeth using cow bone material. It is important in this process never to force them and always provide support at the place where they will remain, indicating an early form of dental treatment with attention to patient comfort and functionality. The term "dvnts" appears to be a typo; it likely should read "dentures." Also, note that historical practices varied

De inscizio del liament le qual ve en la lengua e prohibeys loquela.	Because of the ligature which in Latin is used and forbidden to speak. This sentence seems a mix-up with different topics; it doesn't directly connect to joint pain or gout, but may relate to medical practice convent
Aquest liguament le qual ve dejos la lengua alcunas veguadas o es natural am le qual hom nays, o accidental e accideys per plagua la qual ja es consolidada.	During some seasons of this language which he/she sometimes uses the tongue or naturally does not have it and is occasionally injured by a fully developed frog that lives nearby his/her house unintentionally. E la operacio en lu es que huobres la boca del malaute, le sieu cap existent en le tieu se; e eleva la sieua lengua, e aprop inscideys aquel liament nervos segon la latitut entro que sia solvuda la lengua de la sua recencio.	The operation in this case is to hold the snake’s mouth open with your hand; its head grips you as it does now, and elevate your neck's own tongue if necessary - that muscle nervous tissue lies within which facilitates free movement of his/her current language (tongue).
Mays si en aquela es alcuna duricia o denodacio, e aquo es stat per consolidacio de plagua, lahoras tu gieta unci e scindeys aquel per la latitut entro que aias inscindit le liament e sia dissolvuda la nodacio.	Might it be in that case where the patient has either duricity or diarrhea, and such is for consolidation of pus; then give them one cent and divide what you have by the limit within which you've incised the ligament to dissolve a nodule.
E guarda te que no sia fayta fissura en le preon de la carn e que scindas aqui arceria e vengua flux de sanc.	Be careful not that it is not pain caused by the spine of meat and cut there with an arrow, then use water flow to remove sand.
E aprop sia lavat le vestigi de la inscisio am ayguaros o am vi agre o am aygua frega; e aprop pausa dejos la lengua licini; so es meca la qual tengua le malaute dejos la lengua en quascuna nuoyt per so que no sia consolidat autra veguada.	Then wash away the remnants of incision with arrows, or agree oak, or water; and pause to let your tongue lick it out as well for that I am my main tool which holds back malady so that no other week goes on consolidated.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, pausa sobre le loc vetriol trissat; mays si le sanc ventz, lahoras cauteriza le loc am cauteri lantiginos le qual conveneys ad aquo.	Might it be if there is a flux of sand (referring to kidney stones), then stay over the location with three glasses of vinegar; might it also be for urine containing urea, which often causes pain in specific areas where we cauterize lantigens as they are more soluble in water.
E aprop aquel cura am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	And that kind of care I give for other diseases within which it is healed.

De extraccio de ranula dejos la lengua.	For extracting a ranula, use the tongue to remove it.

Although sometimes accidents occur when the tongue is affixed with wax to name it, and this happens frequently enough that using one' extramurally for speech enhancement seems unnecessary.
E la operacio en lu es que huebras la boca del malaute sesent devant le solel e considera le apostema.	When it is necessary for operations on the malady, you remove six of its shells before sunriser and take into account the abscess.
E si tu le vezes de fusca color o de negra, dur, al qual le malaute no atroba sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel quar es cranc.	If you find it black or dark in colour and does not repent the patient's humour that is evil as hellish crimson blood never can be purified by touching this quarnis (fever), then do no harm to such a man, rather speak gentle words to him.
E si es declinat a blancor, en le qual es humiditat, lahoras tu met le onci en lu, e inscideys aquel am spatum subtil, e inscindeys le de tota partida; e si sanc te ventz en la hora de la tua operacio, lahoras tu pausa desus zegi trissat, so es vetriol, entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	If he is turned towards white wherein his humidity lies and you pour water upon him; then mark that very spot with a thin needle inscribing it all the way through (a treatment method), even if your spirit tells so in the hour of action, stop thereafter three times saying "God be my witness", until he is restrained. It indicates entering his body's humidity and drawing out its essence like blood with a needle without causing pain or harm to him as water has been used for cleansing (a medieval practice).
E aprop retorna a la obra tua entro que lo haias trayt am compliment de lu, entro que sia lavat am vi agre e sal; e cura aquel am l’autra curacio ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	Return to your work within which you had treated him and pay the complement of water agreeing with its purification (a ritual), after washing it clean, ensuring that is remains pure for continued healing; cure his other disease by means of infusion into a liquid substance already cleansed. This refers to returning to treatments where balance must be restored post-treatment and continuing care with additional remedies prepared in water as medicine (a medieval practice).

Translation:
E l’apostema ja tant havia pugat que havia mezes dos ramps entro que eyssiro per dos traucs.	And already there was so much of this sore that it took weeks before I could heal through two cracks caused by pressure.

E aprop yeu abscizi gran partida de lu, e no corria de lu sino un pauc de sanc.	And you have cut off with great care for its sake, and does not run away from it anymore only by the grace of God alone.

Quan catarr deysen a la huvula, e es apostemada e es longa, lahoras ela es nompnada perpendicular; e si es en la partida dejos grossa e redonda, e lahoras ela es apelada buba.	When the catarrh appears in the throat, it is characterized by a prolonged and painful swelling that has no clear perpend0nular axis; when I leave behind thick, round debris or particles, then she's called "bubba." Mays quan es curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio, e no comfereys la tua curacio, e eyssament ja vezes que apostema caut ja es ostat de lu e es subtil, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquela que es agreguadas redonda; e si es ad aquela longitut, e es sanguina, de fusca color o de negre, e no es a lu centiment, lahoras cove que tu temtes la inscizio de lu, quar en aquela es temor sobre le malaute. The mentioning of dark brown or black discharge suggests a concern for possible complications such as an infection, which could require further attention from medical practitioners (e.g., doctors). It's clear that this medieval text is concerned with the detailed diagnosis and treatment protocol based on observable symptoms like swelling without perpendicularity or dark discharge—a reflection of knowledge about disease manifestation in its time, though possibly lacking modern understanding of conditions such as pharyngitis. E quan tu vezes aquela segon la manieyra que yeu he dita de la sua blancor e longuesa, que tu fassas sezer le malaute e premas la lengua de lu am instrument del qual procesic la sua forma e aprop fica le onci en la nuva, e tira aquela en jos e inscideys aquela am un de dos instrumentz les quals e ditz en la inscizio de dos mellas.	When you do this second time according to the manner I have told about his white and long color, when you separate that part which is dirty (the inflamed area), clean it with water for a long period of time using instruments made from what process shapes its form and keeps it in place on my new writing instrument while drawing these lines quickly. You must use one of two instruments here to draw the outlines based on this treatment, as shown below:
E cove que no inscidas aquela sino aquo que es ajustat sobre le terme natural ses addicio, quar si tu inscides de lu mays, lediyras le sieu parlar.	Quan dolor se ha de explicar per les altres sèries naturals del seu adició, e quan la persona li pugneix a mostrar-li el mesmes humors que es soluciona, pot decidir als medics sobre si l'estimarà.
E aprop la inscizio, usa de aquo le qual havem recomtat en la inscizio de dos mellas, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	If it is necessary that I heal the illness in two diseases' places of water (the kidneys), using this liquid which we have recommended for those same locations within where there has been a cure.
Mays si era le malaute espaventat per la inscizio de lu, cove que use de engen en la cauterizacio de lu ses temor, e la manieyra del cauteri en lu no es sino am aygua aguda, e es que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop prem la lengua de lu am le instrument le qual havem dit, e aprop pren de l’aygua la qual havem dita en le capitol de cauterizacio, e comfeys am aquela caus viva, e pausa aquela no spessa ni subtil, e de aquela omple la concavitat de l’estrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	If it is the malady that terrifies him due to his ignorance of its treatment and he fears cauterization in himself for this reason (and since the act of cautioning or burning itself only represents a drop of hot water, which we will soon provide), then you stople your head from the disease by applying pressure with your tongue on that very instrument. Take immediately after me what I have told about it and take afterwards also its content in water for cauterization (which is alive) but not thick nor delicate to touch and thinly coated, which form will be completed:
Sia la extramitat de lu conquavitat en la qual sia pausada la medicina ayssi cum la conquavitat de culher de ray, e pausa le strument am la medicina sobre la vula, e·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu latz per so que corro saliva o musellage de la boca de aquel per la intrinscequa medicina, per so que no deyssenda de aquela deguna causa sobre le golayro de lu e que ledesca aquel.	Let the outside of his cure be in which he has stopped with a finger stop on the cutting edge of the knife and put that instrument over the bubble, so that mucus or saliva comes out from their mouths because of the internal medicine, thus not letting it send to the floor below him due to this cause and keeping them there.
E aprop te la tua ma am la medicina, e exprem aquela sobre la uvula per l’espazi de miega hora entro que vegas aquela esser denegrada e sedada per la mordicacio de la medicina.	You have it under your control with medicine, and you express that which is on the tongue over its space to observe in five minutes how dark it becomes and calms down due to medical biting.
E si vols, prengues coto e envolopes aquel sobre la extremitat del ray, e submergeys le coto en la medicina, e entrometas le ray am le coto en una canula de sobre entro que·l coto adheresca en aquela canula, e fay aquo tantas vetz entro que consiegues aquo que vols de la cauterizacio de la uva, e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela se seccara e cayra aprop tres dias o quatre.	If you want to start the healing process: Cut and wrap that over the extremity of the joint, immerse this wrapping in medicine, then bring the joint into contact with an entry tube wherein it will adhere firmly; thus allowing so much medicinal fluid inside as to fulfill what you desire for cauterization. In due time when these treatments have dried and fallen off after three or four days on its own accord
E si indigeysses que iteras la medicina, itera aquela, e aprop la cauterizacio abstergeys en le circuit de la uva am coto enbegut en boder, e mondifica am aquel aquo que es en le circuit de lu de la medicina, e sia lavat am aygua frega, e sia curat deforo am embrocacio, e dedintz am guarguarismes entro que sia sanat.	If you have indigestion that travels through the medicine, continue with such treatments and avoid hard cauterization within the grape's circuit wherein it will enter along its border; then remove any fluid present in this circuit of the medication, washsealed as well. Treat for dysentery should be done without embrocage (binding), cleaned with hot water, and attended by gold coin to cover expenses until healing is achieved.
E aquesta especia de curacio es pus salva que inscizio e pus long de temor.	This kind of treatment was saved because I overcame my fears and decided to learn about it despite initial reservations or apprehension regarding its efficacy or safety. The act demonstrates courage, open-mindedness in the face of traditional medical practices
Alcunas veguadas es curada la uvuola am aquo que es pus subtil que cauteri e inscizio, quar es curat am subfumigacio en aquesta manieyra: recipe calament, ysop, origua, ruda, scicados arabic, camamilla, broyda e semblant ad aquels de las erbas, e ajusta totas aquelas causas, o alcunas de lor, en una ola, e sian submergidas am vi agre, e bulhan; e la ola sia be lutada am lut decentment, e sia en le mieg loc de la ola un trauc, sobre le qual sia pausat un instrument conquau de aram segon aquesta manieyra; sia fayt de argent o de aram.	During some times I was cured with the water that had been gently used for treatment instead of hard cauterization, following this unique method: prepare a salve by boiling together chamomile and yarrow; add rosemary, rue, Arabic wormwood, marigold flowers (camomilla), clover leaves/buds, thyme sprigs, sage stems or foliage, all these being mixed as one into a poultice. Apply this mixture directly to the cause of pain, sometimes applying more than once; then place it on its own in warm water and cover with an empty shell (bulhan). The container holding the poultice should be shaken gently for about 30 seconds every hour while still hot until a solid lump forms. A rock sourced from clean soil is placed directly onto this hardened mixture, then securely held in place by another of these rocks with acidic properties (acharn), which are obtained naturally without the use of chemicals or commercial preparations; after about one hour and thirty minutes at ambient temperature during daylight hours. The final cauterization must be done carefully to avoid damage using either silver nitrate sticks or copper wire, following a precise technique as detailed in this method (note: traditional practices may involve the use of caustic substances that could cause harm if not handled correctly).
E sia entromesa la extremitat en la boca del malaute entro que la vapor poge a la uvula sobre la quanula, entro que la uvula sia mot ofuscada.	Even if the patient is made to swallow and place warmth on their tongue until it reaches his or her uvula when they open their mouth for treatment, then once the taste buds are numbed by heat, proceed with further steps in the process. It's best done before this substance reaches full ripeness to avoid issues with digestion as well as physical deformities like fistulas at the joint where it is placed – hence these apes should only be punctured in their naked form (before being dressed) so that they don’t get eaten and become elongated along with other body parts, leading to a hernia or another medical condition.

E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre. Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu. Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	May one use a soft cautery for puncturing the flesh as allowed by law or when it is necessary according to what the member desires.

E if there is no resolution in the water we have mentioned beforehand that has a vehement effect on ubalance causes and you will help to extract it using an instrument called suction needle which also known as syringe, this was its form: It could be made of silver or gold but subtly crafted like tiny lion conqueror with a slender horn underneath the head resembling in shape.
E la manieyra del eyssiment de la urina per aquel es que prenguas le fiel doblat e lies en la extramitat de lu lana o coto per bona liadura; e entrometas las extramitatz del fiel en la partida dejos de la ciringua, e inscideys am las forfexs si superflueys alcuna causa de la lana, mays intromet la en la canula am vehemencia E aprop enongeys la ciringua am boder e am album de huou.	E the method of urine collection for that which grips the leather with dobbles and lies in its exterior fabric or wool, providing good comfort; insert these external parts into the pocket holes made by the curling iron, ensuring no excess thread from the fur remains outside. Then place them on the canvas at the border and center of the urine collection device for better containment using a cautery needle with force applied to secure it firmly in both areas while holding hands as mentioned earlier; ensure all these measures are taken carefully noting every detail closely, especially observing any extra thread from fur that may fall outside.
E fay cezer le malaute sobre la selha, e embroca la vesiqua de lu e la vergua am olis umitz, e oli de oliva e ayguaros. Ensure you place everything correctly noticing every detail closely while attaching these items carefully as per earlier mention; always hold hands during this procedure for support in patient management
E aprop entromet la ciringua am facilitat entro que pervengua a la razit de la vergua; e aprop dobla la vergua desus a la partida del embelic; e aprop empelleys la ciringua dintz aquela; e aprop empelleys aquela entro que pervengua a la vesica, e aquela centa le malaute esser pervenguda a la causa vuoda, e no es fayt asso segon aquest orde, sino le meat en le qual va a tortuositat.	Then place the urine collection device to facilitate flow into its tubing; fold back and secure this hose above where it connects with the catheter embolus ball (a step often used in modern-day urethral catheters), then double up on that end of the tube, place pressure gently below at an angle to ensure urine flow towards its center; once collected inside a container for further analysis this will also lead stones back into their cause within the bladder avoiding unnecessary manipulation as per our order. E aquo en que es conoguda fistula penetrant entro al cul e no-penetrant, es que tu metas le tieu dit endic en le cul, e entrometas tenta subtil de eram o de ferr en la fistula quan no y es turtuositat.	Eau dans laquelle est connue une fistule pénétrante au nombril et non-pénétrante, c'est que tu mets ton chiffon dedans le nombril et essaie doucement de la remplacer par des métal ou du fer lorsqu'elle n'est pas retirée.

E de la medicacio per la qual es sperat juvament en lu es que tu ignes cauteri subtil segon le ample de la fistula, ayssi cum es precedit, e intrometas aquel ignit en la fistula entro que pervengua entorn le cuol; e aprop itera aquel doas o tres vetz entro que sapias que ja son adhustas totas aquelas carns ajustadas fistuladas que so semblantz a cana de pluma de ausel. E aprop cura aquela am calguas envolopadas en boder entro que en yescan totas aquelas carns que so adhustas, e aprop cura aquela am medicinas la carn engendrantz e consolidantz, e si es sanada, bo es; e sino, lahoras no es sana en degun temps per autra curacio. De curacio de las plaguas.	Of cold maladies or colds.
Yeu ja e dit en la divisio de la curacio de las plaguas aquo que convenia al libre, e yeu dic assi la curacio de aquelas am ma e am medicinas segon le conpliment.	Ye have already said in the division of cold treatments that it was necessary for free accessibility and you spoke also about self-care with accompanying medicine according to harmony.
Donc dic que las plaguas son diversificadas segon aquo en que son faytas las plaguas e segon le loc sobre le qual cazo las plaquas.	So that is said in the division of cold treatments: colds are diverse depending on whether they cause pain or not and according to where it happens on the body, specifically mentioned here for joints (the term "plaquas" refers to swelling).
E las causas per que motas vetz son faytas las plaguas so ayssi cum getament de peyra, o inscisio d’espaza o de cotel, o percussio am lansa, o am fustz, o am sageta, o semblantz ad aquels de motas causas.	And the causes by which motion occurs for colds are with application of stones like basalt (peyra), flint chips (espaza) or tile shards, incision and knife cutting, percussion on bones, lance thrusting, spear throwing or similar actions that resemble those motions causing the cold. These remedies address the causes mentioned above for colds where motion plays a role in their development.
Mays las plaguas que so en les locz del cos so ayssi cum plagua la qual catz sobre le cap, o·l col, o·l pietz, o·l ventre, o·l fitge, e semblantz ad aquels dels membres.	May the cold maladies that are in those places be treated with worms (plaga) laid on top of the head or neck, shoulders, back, belly, groin and similar conditions found within members' body parts as well. Mays si no so separadas, lahoras leyssa las entro que se poyresca la plagua, que la extraccio de lor es alleujada.	If they are not separated enough, then let them suffice for the extraction of that offending flesh; its removal is therefore facilitated without additional effort. (Line by line translation)
E de las autras plaguas accidentz en les autres membres le juvament en curacio es le juvament de aquo que havem dit.	And of the other offending flesh infections occurring in other parts, their removal during treatment is done with water that we have mentioned earlier as a remedy for it too. (Line by line translation)
De las plaguas del ventre.	Of abdominal wounds or issues. (Translation from Latin to modern English without further context.)
L’indisposicio la qual accideys en le ventre es o gran, o pauc, o migiera.	The condition which causes pain in the belly is either great, little or migrating. (Line by line translation)
De la gran alcunas veguadas yeys le budel o nervi del budel, per que es fayta intromissio de lor e la sutura de lor esser pus vehement e pus subtil.	Of the great condition that sometimes opens up or affects a part of the bowels through which it becomes inflamed and painful, hence making its removal both vigorous and subtle due to its nature. (Line by line translation)
E disrupcio petita es fayta dificil per autra manieyra, e siec se que la reduccio de lor es pus dificil, si no te coytes de la intromissio de lor al sieu loc tantost, quar se ubre e es engrossat per que le intrament de lu es fayt difficil.	And an interruption is difficult to achieve through other means, and its reduction is hard unless the extrusion of that offending flesh back into place after removal happens immediately alongside it being inflamed so much with blood at once that the hand becomes covered in it too – making further intrusions painful. (Line by line translation)
E donc la milhor disrupcio es migiera, quar en aquela no es dificil la reduccio del budel, ayssi cum es dificil en las doas specias denant ditas.	And hence the best treatment would be migration, for in that place it is difficult to reduce the intestine or hernia and hard with those four humors mentioned beforehand by them; but easier herein are such treatments because of these factors.
E sapias que sutura del ventre es segon quatre manieyras, mays doas suturas son comunas que conveneysso en suturas de las autras plaguas del cors.	Even though the belly has four kinds of stitches made by hand, some may be used commonly as well in sewing other parts of the body too.
E duas autras suturas proprias comunican a las autras plaguas, mays empero so mays proprias en la sutura del ventre.	Two other stitches specifically communicate with each other' endlessly; but on the belly may there be specific ones too.

Donc dic que quan la plagua es petita e es eyssit alcuna causa del budel per aquela, e es fayt dificil a reduzir aquel, lahoras aquo es en una de doas manieyras: o per parvitat de la disrupcio ayssi cum havem dit, o quan al budel es venguda inflacio per la frigiditat de l’ayre.	Therefore it is said that when the breech comes and there's a cause for some protrusion of the bowels (or belly), such as an intestinal obstruction with distension, or due to fetal position causing reduced space in the uterus. It becomes difficult to reduce this situation; it can be done through one of two methods: either small disruption of the amniotic sac allowing passage when there's urgent need (quickening), as previously mentioned for reducing cord-related issues, or if the bowels are distended by cold air exposure. These medieval thoughts on resolving certain birth emergencies have historical significance but differ greatly from modern obstetric practices which involve a more detailed assessment of maternal and fetal conditions using advanced medical technology to ensure safe delivery procedures today. E aprop yeu iteregui e descubregui sobre le os segondament sobre le descubriment primier, e atrobegui continua corrupcio am le os. E serregui aquo que a mi apares de aquela corrupcio, e aprop yeu fo perforsat fayre la curacio de lu e restauracio, e no es restaurat. E adonc yeu descubri sobre lu autra veguada e no cessegui inscidir le os petit a petit particuladament e perforsa la restauracio de lu, e no es restaurat entro que inscidigui entorn un palm de lu, e aquel extraxi am la medula sua, e aprop restauregui aquel am medicinas, e es consolidat leugierament e sanat. This was then restored using medical means—this is how healing occurred through therapeutic intervention consistent with the humoral theory that prevailed in medieval medicine. The extraction process aimed to draw out excess humor (bodily fluids) believed to cause disease, and this method of treatment led to recovery as well as a form of spiritual cleansing or purification within the broader context of medieval healing practices. E donc sanat es per sanacio entiera, e nada es en loc de os carn dura; e es fayta bona la disposicio de lu en le sieu cors e retornec la vertut de lu; e es conversat en las suas disposicios e no fec a lu contrarietat en ambulacio ni nocument en denguna causa. Mays si es os eminent en loc del cors ja trauquat, lahoras cove que tu secces aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas liament e strenh aquel en la extremitat de aquel os eminent, e comanda ad alcu que extenda aquel en sus; e pausa aquel liament de lana pus gros del primier liament; e aprop lia aquel sobre la carn que es dejos le os, e exten la extramitat de lu per que atires la carn a las partidas dejos, e tu descuebras la carn sobre le loc le qual voles serrar per que la serra no leda la carn.	If your bone is protruding in the location where it was previously fractured: first you wrap a bandage around and stiffen that end of the protruded bone, command someone to extend this part towards their; then stop wrapping with thick wool until reaching about one-third above from which point begin applying pressure on your skin directly overlying the injured area. E at first take from him the water which is necessary and dissolve it in a vessel of water and honey; administer clyster to his ventricle with that liquid, cleanse its orifices thoroughly, then apply medicine for as many hours as needed by doctors.
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	At first take out that which is necessary, and give water for as many days as it takes to purify the ventricle and make wet the seed (semen).
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	Ever sometimes they are cleansed by water from ashes when not using this present medicine, because you take the ash of charcoal and place it in the water; then add that to a person who is already clean inside where he confesses his sinful habit which has become too much for him.
E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	If the malady does not tolerate Egyptian medicine nor ash water from charcoal as cures, then you wash that person with mud and saltwater mixed in three parts of spring water; also mix mustard oil with beeswax melted until it becomes a paste. The property of this mixture is to cleanse and purify, and bind the sinews mostly when excessive driedness or stiffness has occurred on them while they were bound by wax (a common practice for treating various joint issues in medieval times).
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	Once you have used some water and feel that the sinews are already too stiff or painful to bear weight on them, then with this same medicinal bath apply saltwater in a way that it seems as though the flesh is dissolving into nothingness (a technique sometimes mentioned for alleviating severe joint pains).
E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.	Because you have clothes of fine linen that dissolve in rosemary oil and apply this oily dressing on the stiffness; or, with some medicinal baths using different herbs known to me from texts about wax treatments (herbal medicine was widely practiced during medieval times), here I'll describe them as having properties similar to those found in rosemary oil.
E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.	If the orifice of sinus is tight in which no catheter (clisteri) can be received, then gradually increase that small iron ferright instrument until it reaches the required size while wrapped in Egyptian ointment oil or basic medicinal dressing to prevent loss and ensure proper application.
E semblantment si le orrifici es ample, lahoras tu agregua las labias de lu am sutura e layssa de lu quantitat en la qual intre le clisteri ses addicio.	If the opening of sinus is spacious enough, then you should insert and fixate two metal discs in a specified quantity within which to pour medicinal liquid from catheter until fullness is achieved before application.
E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	If the orifice of which limb is elevated beyond its parts above, then dry that inlet throughput from urine within which to make patient'throbbing less intense until breath begins again when leg has been confined and tethered so as not to impede sinus expansion. When knee joint becomes contracted due to swelling or other causes causing painful immobility, the foot may be elevated on a blocker above eye level while wrapped in ointment oil for relief of symptoms before mobilizing leg movements again.
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	If it is not possible to empty the sinus through urine as desired, then pierce that which you have prepared for treatment of limb in accordance with patient's wish and prepare member anatomically necessary ensuring no residual causes remain obstructing movement within treated leg.
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	E take convalescent remedies that are suitable for the current state of your illness, so as to extend those applied directly on the cloth you wish.
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	Even when the cloth is of such great quantity that it facilitates communication with all parts, and I encase in the center of the mucus mouth an extensive pus as wide as the mouth itself; and then extend over another piece of linen from his underwear legs according to the amount of pus, and pause it above there so far away that part of its surface is inside the orifice of the sinus, for this way he will be drawn out by himself at least once a week.
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac. When your medical practice continues in this manner of treatment and you see the substance that has already adhered to the sacro-mamillary area is now also attached firmly by its own accord, or it acquires attachment on its own as well; perhaps tomorrow I will separate these attachments using cautery – but when removing such materials from a patient’s body today you change their dressings and renew bandages. In modern terms: When treating an inflamed inguinal hernia with persistent discharge, it becomes necessary to manage the wound by changing dressings frequently until healing is achieved or surgical intervention may be required.
Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu.	Might it be from the sinus that such narrow spaces harbor viruses? E si del sinu aprop motz dias es yssit brac indigest, lahoras sapias que·l sinu no adhereys; e si es tardada la adherencia del sinu e es la causa prolonguada, lahoras tu ajusta en exsiccacio de las medicinas, e si las medicinas so humidas en lor substancia e en la sua vertut, son seccas ayssi cum enguent dyafinicon, quan es en lu ajustada superfluitat de addicio de zegi.	Even if the sinus opens up and pours out bile indigested for days, doctors understand that it will not adhere; however, delayed sinus opening and persistent sticking is caused by medicinal substances applied externally with ointment dressings or poultices. E le mays derier am le qual es curat, es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e sia dissout en oli rozat, e sia sobre lu vojat vi antic engual en la sua substancia, e aprop comfeys aquel am lu, e usa de aquel. And it seems like in that attempt when not distracted by others' presence, using fine cloth gloves and oil dissolved in water which have an ancient emollient effect on their skin as well being spread over them with one touching hand while applying medicine to the patient themselves; or having gloves made of muslin and aloes and ensis for cleaning tasks when they are inside, rubbing all over the body's warmth until it becomes sweaty. E alcunas veguadas so administratz am lu aristologia longua e razitz de lili celesti (e es lili celesti) e farina de errs e centaurea, e usa de aquels simples o ajustatz, trissa aquels e cribela e polveriza sobre le mel le qual he recomtat; e husa de lu.	And sometimes they administer ancient aristology and herbal remedies of celestial lilies (and it is also the celestial lily) and wheat flour, erythrina, and centaurea, using simple or adjusted medicines by rubbing them in all over this mixture that they have recommended. E si es prolonguat le sinu, e no es sanat per aquesta curacio, lahoras sapias que la corrupcio es en le preon de lu, e ja fa enquisicio en les osses o en les autres membres durs o als liaments; lahoras tu le cura am curacio fistular, ayssi cum desus es dit.	If the swelling continues and it does not heal with this treatment, then you know that corruption is in his bones or other hard parts of the body such as muscles or tendons; already have investigated these areas by examining the bones or other affected members. Now cure him as if curing a fistula, according to what is said above (about treating with inflamed joints).

Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla.
