De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	 From indecision comes such diseases as gouty arthritis or rheumatism due to imbalances in bodily humors
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.	 Vices so son varicos (Vices are such as varicose veins), and they involve thickly swollen moody blood vessels that come into the muscles of our body, mostly in the legs' cups due to heavy physical movement or standing for long periods. This condition mainly affects itinerants, laborers, and carriers.
Adonc cove que tu administres purguacio del cors de colera negra alcunas veguadas am expulcio fort, e aprop sangna le pacient de la vena basilica.	Then administer the black plague patient's body purge periodically to force out disease with strong bleeding of blood from the vein (the hepatic or portal) through which it circulates within their liver and digestive system, causing a fever as symptom.
Mays la curacio de lor am ferr es segon dos manieyras: la una es que sia inscizas e sia atirat aquel sanc negre, e l’autra manieyra es que sia elevada la vena e sia extrayta tota.	For their cure may consist of two methods: one is that they must be informed and awakened (to care for themselves), while the other method involves lifting the vein with blood flowing from it, then extracting it completely out of body through an incision on foot or leg. The removal might result in a temporary loss of movement in their legs if unsuccessful; otherwise, they would recover function within days to weeks as healing occurs naturally without scarring post-extraction due to the absence of clot formation and inflammation after bloodletting from an artery with low pressure (arterial bleeding).
La seccio de lu es segon aquesta manieyra: embroca al comensament la camba am aygua cauda mot entro que le sanc gros sia resolvut, que es feculent de la camba, e aprop strenh la camba del malaute a la partida pus sobirana de la coyssa entro a la partida dejos del denol am una benda, e aprop secca la vena en un loc, o en dos, o en tres am seccio ampla, e aprop eleva le sanc negra am la tieua ma de la partida dejos de la camba entro en sus, e desus en jus, entro que del sanc sia yssida la quantitat que voles e que vezes habastar, e la qual tollera la vertut del malaute.	La section of this treatise is as follows: When the patient'selves are found according to these methods, apply a cooling cloth on or near water soaked cotton placed inside that large sack and tighten it strongly around where there's protruded hernia between thigh muscles at hip level using one bandage wrap starting from below part of body wrapping up towards head; dry the vein either in a single location, two locations or three as wide as possible within this section. E aprop lia aquela, e comanda a lu que abstengua de las viandas colera negra engendrantz.	And apply that to her and command for the patient to refrain from black meat dishes causing discomfort.
E itera la curacio per fleubotomia quan las venas so umplidas e aquo notz al malaute.	Repeat this treatment when veins are inflamed and if there's noticeable black substance from the hernia, indicating a need for an operation called bleeding-out or flebotomy.
Mays la elevacio de lor es segon aquesta manieyra: tu que razas la camba del malaute, si en lu so motz pels, e aprop met le en banh e embroca la camba de lu am aygua cauda entro que s’enrogesesca e las venas sian exuberadas; o que sia exercitat per exercici fort, si banh no es a tu present, entro que·l membre sia scalfat.	As for this method: Raise their legs as explained hereafter: When you've placed the bandage on where there are protruding hernias and it presses against them to reduce swelling (which is recommended when applying cold), then place another cloth or pad over that area while wet, soaking in water until dry; if a bath isn't available at your moment of attention now apply forceful exercise for strengthening the limb. De extraccio de sagetas.	De extractione medicamentorum.
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas. E aquela que es segon les membres e las pessas en las quals cazo es segon dos manieyras: quar les membres o so membres principals concaus, ayssi cum le cervel, le cor, e·l fitge, e le pulmo, e les ronhos, e les budels, e la vezica, e a lor semblantz; e donc quan catz en alcu de aquestz membres e aparo a tu senhals de mort, la qual causa yeu recomtare aprop, lahoras cove que tu evites extraccio de aquela sageta en aquels quar la mort siec aquel en le qual en las majors disposicios, e quan a tu no appareysso aquestz mals senhals, e la sageta no es amaguada en la profunditat del membre, lahoras tu extratz aquela e cura la plagua. Mays les autres membres ayssi cum es la cara, le col, e·l golayro, e las spallas e le adjutori, e les spondils del dos, e la furcula, e la coysa, e la camba e a lor semblantz dels membres, son salvatz segon las majors disposicios quan la sageta no atroba vena ni arteria e no es sageta venenosa.	May the other members take care of me (my face, my neck, and chest), as well as arms and legs—and attend to spinal discs in between backbones, shoulder blades, rib cage; their corresponding limbs’ appearances are saved when sorcery does not obstruct a vein or artery nor is it poisonous. E extrayssi autra sageta a un Juzeu la qual cazec en lu en lo grays del sieu huel, dejos la palpebra pus dejos, e la sageta ja era occultada e no so conseguit de aquela sino una petita extremitat am la qual adhereys al sieu fust, e era gran sageta de las sagetas agudas dels Turcs , am ferr leon en la qual no havia aurelhas. E senat es le Juzieu , e no accidic en le sieu huel mal accident.	However, if it is not a young person who has been examined and found to be in good health at the time of inspection for this purpose; then there will not occur harmful consequences on their head wound.
E extrayssi una autra sageta a un home Crestia la qual era cazuta en le golayro, e era sageta arabica, e es aquela a la qual so aurelhas; e adonc yeu inscidegui sobre aquela entre doas guidegi, e ja era submersa en le golayro de lu; e adonc yeu so subtiliat am aquela, e aprop extraxi aquela, e es sanat le Crestia .	The other kind to extract from an Arabian home was such that it sought in the lion's pelt and were acute types; its claws are on this (frog skin), and after inscribing over these between two guiding lines, I have already submerged him/her into leopardskin of man; then gently withdrawing from that substance with a pointed tool in the proper way to extract it. And so healed the Crestia (person).
E extraxi autra sageta a un home la qual era cazuta en le sieu ventre, e cogitegui que moris per aquela; e donc, pus que foro passatz xxx dias e no es mudat sobre lu alcuna causa de las suas disposicios, inscidegui sobre la sageta e engenagui sobre aquela, e es sanat, e no accidic a lu accident mal.	Outside of necessity I extracted another story from a man who had been couched in his belly, and examined him to find that he died because of it; so after passing forty days without any change on the surface due to their conditions, having investigated this person'dis suffering, treating them accordingly, they recovered fully and did not have further accidents.
E vi mays un home en le qual cazec una sageta en le dos de lu, e consolidada es la plagua sobre lu, e pus que foc aprop set ans, yssic la sageta en la razitz de la coyssa.	Even if there is someone in the room who catches a sick bird on his two legs and when they are consolidated under him, place it next to them for about nine months; after this time you can release the chick from its cavity at the end of the cesspit.
E vi una femna a la qual cazec sageta en le sieu ventre, e la plagua es consolidada dedintz lu, e no es mudada en las suas disposicios en re, e la femna no atrobec nocument en alcunas de las suas opperacios naturals.	Even if there is a woman who catches chicks in her belly and when they are consolidated inside of her, do not move them from their positions; furthermore the woman does not take any harmful actions against some of her natural defenses.
E vi un autre home al qual cazec sageta en la sua cara e consolidada es la plagua e romas la sageta, no atrobant aqui mota dolor, e motz semblantz ad aquestz.	And there is another man who catches chicks in his face and when they are consolidated on him, he crushes the chick without causing any pain; like this attracts similar creatures to them.
E extrayssi la sageta del home dels princeps del rey que era cazuda en le mieg loc del nas sieu e ja havia declinat a la partida dreyta un petit, e occultada era tota la sageta. E yeu fu appelat a la curacio de lu aprop le cazement de la sageta entro a tres dias.	Therefore, they were called the healing of that person for their hunting activity within three days.

E yeu recomti a tu la qualitat de extraccio de alcunas sagetas per que pauses aquo regla e significacio sobre aquo que no he dit, quar las partidas de aquesta art e las difinicios de aquela no so conprehendudas am narracio ni no comprehen aquelas le libre. De fleubotomia de las venas.	Form a coercive approach to this extreme method that involves bloodletting from certain veins, which is then directed towards

Mays las venas que so fleubotomadas en les brasses so v; quar de aquelas es una cephalica, e es deves le latz silvestre; e le poble appela “la vena del cap”, e sorda, e es vena migiera, e es composta de un ram de la basilica, e de autre ram de la cephalica; e nomna aquela le poble “vena de tot le cors”, e basilica es vena la qual es pausada en le latz domestic, e es nomnada “citillar”, e nompnan aquela les vulguars “vena del ventre”; e funis del bras, e es pausada sobre le focil, e es aquela en la qual es fleubotomat, e es aquela que appar sobre le poutz per apparicio manifesta; e salvatella, e es la vena que es entre lo dit auricular e·l pus petit dit, e so en lu dos ramps.	Mays las venas arriba del flebectomado en les braçades se veixen as una cephalica i és deves l'arbor de silvestre; es la que nomnada vulguari "la vena del cap", ja sorda, amb origens migratoriàrias com a seva planta composta d'un ram per un cop partitix al basilic, però donat altres due parts en als ribetes cephalics. Aquesta és la que nomna vulgària "vena de tot el cors" i es una femenícia; es la vena cui sorg corpuscullar tal com ara tinguda per les mans d'estany a llargues fins amb un foc, ja en temps des del sol. La veu és més evident al ser trobat encara que el fet embruta una vegada, i es pot dir de si l'experiència augúmenta la probabilitat de les fets; tots els mans aflorants nomnaden "manes desfetaures" en certs llenguatges mediterraniors. Aquest fet no és sempre senzill per poder trobar i, ja que es pot fer una incisio amb un instrument puntigar o pincelada (a les seves pròpies temps) para soltar l'entrepint; però aquest ha de ser fet con gran cautet. Aquests mans també sorgen en el senyal dels muscles, i els podem visitar amb la vista directa del pigment dorsal que es troba encara a les col·lumens (començaix fins al cap). Per tal motiu se podria considerar un fet de diagnosi. Aquests mans comen una gran quantitat de lixa, ja que el sabor desprovided entre l'humor fred i la humors fridescents; aquests paresms soltens al cuer a través del moviment dels hombres per aravenir les partícules en els pies. Aquest fet es pot veure als costums mediterrànics
E en le pe e la camba so tres venas; la una de aquelas es que es dejos la curvatura del denolh del latz silvestre; e la segonda es sophena, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz domestic; e la vena sciatica, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz silvestre; e en la camba son autras venas semblantz ad aquelas. E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	It is known that the species of bone fractures in their studies are diverse; this includes not only curved (arched) fractures but also those resulting from impacts on sharp objects like stones or metal edges, as well as some occurring along the length of a limb's shaft. These can result from injuries sustained while climbing trees and rocks—important context for their understanding of such traumas in medieval environments—or could be unintentional fractures without obvious external causes when writing about them, which also refers to childhood accidents or the presence of a small crack within bone. This recognition is crucial because it underscores not only medical conditions and terminologies that are relevant for diagnosis but also provides insights into social practices like climbing in medieval times and daily life hazards faced by people, including children. Understanding these aspects enriches the historical comprehension of healthcare challenges during this period when written records were sparse or focused mainly on treatment without detailed explanations of causes and conditions as modern medicine does today. To aid future historians, it's essential to carefully transcribe and translate such texts while considering their medical accuracy in light of current knowledge but also the cultural context that shapes how people interpreted health issues at different times. E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut. E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.	If the caustic attack occurs, then after some days pass until it ceases to occur; and you can lift that second one by any means of lifting or carrying which you are able to perform.
E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	You understand that restoration and cautery of the body part, wherein you have been wounded by humors in excessive quantities is an easier way than cutting out bone from which it has become inflamed.
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	Return that second one, as soon as the memory of yourself revives.
Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma.	If in the bone it is settled down (calmed), then you may extend that member fractured from either part of your body, if such as are small legs or arms so they be likewise; and when a man's arm becomes smaller than his leg due to wasting diseases affecting all limbs. Alternatively extending the two shoulders with one hand (if both shoulder blades need extension) or extend only one shoulder blade along its chest muscle, holding it firmly in place as you stand up straight and do not lean over; this is beneficial for recovery of strength and endurance to move about without difficulty.
E sia la tua posicio am la qual pauses le membre loc engual segon la sua figura natural, mentre que las partidas so extandudas del membre trenquat, lahoras te perforsa que fassas retornar aquelas addicios am engen e segon quascuna manieyra que poyras en lor locs.	Its position on the ground is such that it pauses a limb in its natural alignment while parts of extended extremities are stretched, and you perform this by returning those additional appendages to their respective places according to any particular measure they desire for themselves or have been given. This text advises proper placement of an injured body part on the ground with support from other members when dealing with joint issues such as gout that typically manifest in feet due to cold humors affecting bodily parts, and emphasizes respectful handling while applying measures at specific points across different regions of a patient' enduring these symptoms.
E guarda te segon la tua forssa que no accida sobre le malaute per la tua operacio delor ni lesio; e perforsa te segon le tieu poder que tu appliques la un os am l’autre son companho segon lors milhors formas.	Guard your footwear which does not impede upon the injured area for treatment or injury as well, and apply force accordingly to one bone with another in its company during various forms of movement you can perform given strengths at such times; this text underscores attentiveness towards accessories that may interfere while providing care for injuries related to gout. E cove que en aquela hora aprofitablament tu toques am la tua ma aquel, e si vezes aqui alcuna causa diversa, rectifiqua aquel e enguala aquel per la quantitat de la tua vertut.	And when you come upon the time that it benefits most greatly from your touch at its place and if ever there's any cause elsewhere causing distress or discomfort, then rectify such issue by addressing as much of the patient’s virtue (goodwill) as possible; this text underlines timely intervention to provide relief during times when a limb is most amenable for treatment in conjunction with remedying additional causes that may impede healing or comfort.
E exquiva vehement extenssio e compressio, ayssi cum fan mots fols metges que motas veguadas fan accidir apostema caut per la sua operacio, o fan accidir contraccio en le membre ayssi cum havem vist aquo per la operacio de lor motas veguadas.	Even a violent extension and compression are acceptable methods that doctors who habitually perform caustic interventions through their work, or they happen to experience contraction in the same member where we have seen them show us water during their treatments. (Translation: Even using strong forceful techniques like extending and compressing joints is permissible when treating conditions that typically require such methods by practitioners who often use caustics as part of treatment, or alternatively they might experience muscle contractions in the same limb where we have observed these treatments.)
E aprop annecteys, aprop equacio e decent operacio e strictura de aquel membre, e repaus e tranquilitat; amoneste le malaute sobre aquo e fay le squivar que no maugua aquel en la hora de las suas vigilias e del sieu dormir, e ves la sua revolucio e agitacio, e deves la sua egestio, e deves totz les sieus movementz am tota la sua vertut; e aguarda se que la posicio del membre sia posicio am la qual sia asegurada la dolor, la qual causa es quar quan sent en la disposicio de la posicio del membre delor o lesio; lahoras cove que permutes aquel ad autra disposicio de aquela am la qual non senta dolor; e guarda am aquo que la posicio de lu aquela sia dreyta e engual, per so que al membre non accida tortuositat quan es restaurat. E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.	E the quality of a relaxed limb is that which I recommend, for it follows various dimensions in its size and shape as well as these characteristics; this will make their treatment easier because you understand them better when they are loose and not rigidly bound together or attached to each other.
E de aquels que son petits ayssi cum le bras e·l dit e·l focil e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras cove que la envolucio sia de drap mol subtil. Mays aquels que so grosses ayssi cum la cuoyssa o la camba, cove que en aquels sia envolucio lada e dura, quar la liadura lada connecteys le membre gran e strenh aquel de tota part am strictura engual, enayssi que en lu no intre macula.	And of those who are large with the hernia or sac like it says here about their covering being smooth and hard therein; this should suffice as these connect tightly to a larger member throughout all parts undergoing strictures, ensuring that they remain encased within even if one does not observe them in plain sight.
E aprop comensa, aprop la tua evacuacio de equacio, pausar liament convenient ad aquo, sobre le loc de aquela fractura am tres envolucios o quatre segon que·l membre mereys; e strenh la tua ma un petit am le liament.	And begin with your evacuation of the equine's belly and pause its lameness at a convenient point for water, over where that fracture is located as mentioned here in three or four wrappings according to how much this member requires; hold tight by laying it light on top.
E aprop ve am aquel a la partida pus sobirana del loc de la fractura, e strenh mens que no foc la tua strictura am la qual has strengut le loc de la fractura. E aprop elongua te am envolucio del loc de la fractura un pauc, e mollifiqua la strictura petit a petit, entro que prenguas del loc sa una gran partida.	And then you return the bone to its place in the location of the break using gentle pressure and gradually loosening it little by little until your hand takes only a small portion of the affected area. E aprop pren una autra benda e envolveys aquela autra veguada sobre le loc trenquat am envolucio, e aprop ve am las envolucios a la partida pus dejos de la fractura; e sia la tua operacio en la strictura de la envolucio e en mollificacio de aquela segon que havem dit en la envolucio primieyra desus. E aprop pausa entre las volucios de stopa leon o drap am le qual sia engualada la tortuositat de la fractura, si en lu es tortuositat; e sino, no pauses en lu alcuna causa. E sian las stelhas de la maytat de canna lada raza, e be formada saviament; o sian de fust de pi; o de ramps de palma ; e sia le ample de quascuna stelha segon aquesta forma e aquesta figura:	And these are bamboo cane strips of the lathing race, and be formed carefully beforehand. Empero cove que la astelha que es pausada sobre aquela fractura sia pus grossa e pus lada un petit que las autras astelhas, e la longitut de la stela segon qu’es legut al membre en magnitut e parvitat; e aprop strenh sobre las astelhas am autra benda segon la tua primieyra strictura; e aprop lia desus am fiel decentment segon que havem dit de strictura, e es que sia la tua strictura segon le loc de la fractura mes, e quant mes es alonguat de la fractura, es mendre la strictura. E cove que les fils sian migiers en grossesa e subtilitat, e sian de li mol; e si les fils so grosses, ayssi cum yeu he vist per la operacio de alcus fols pausantz les lors fils de cordas de li tort, e es error gran, quan catz la strictura fora equalitat. E eyssament fils subtils no so convenientz, quar tu no consaguiras per strictura am aquels aquo que voles, e no cove que entre astela e astela haja mens de un dit. E si le malaute es ledit per las extremitatz de las stelas aprop la strictura en les locs sas, lahoras pausa dejos aquelas de stopa leon o lana carmenada entro que aquo no li fassa lesio. Alcunas veguadas fractura es am plagua, e accideys disrupcio en la codena, e yeu vindre am rememoracio en aquela en le capitol segon singularitat. E aquesta es la manieyra dels emplaustres am les quals les Antics restauravan, les quals so pausatz sobre fractura e dislocacio e torcio.	This is the method of placements used by ancient restorers for which they would leave it over cases involving fractures and dislocations (and twists).
Manieyra de emplaustra comu abruejat de restaurament de fractura, convenient a motas compleccios e majorment a las femnas e als efantz, quar es de aquo sobre le qual no ventz calor ni freg: e es que prenguas de polvera de moli, e es la medula de la farina que pen deves le movement de la mola en las paretz del moli.	This method of placement as we know from ancient restoration techniques for which they would leave it over cases involving fractures and dislocations (and twists), is convenient to pedestris, mainly women and elves; this has nothing on us regarding heat or cold: one needs leather-soled shoes sprinkled with sandalwood powder, and the millstone made of fine flour from which you must grind stone in its mortar. E comfeys aquel ayssi cum es, sino que cribelles aquel am album de huou, e pausa la comfeccio de lu no-spessa ni subtil; e aprop usa de aquela. Autra manieyra de emplaustre restaurant fractura e dislocacio e torcio: recipe de assafetida, de lapdanum, de acacia, de enula, e migrach, que es razit de milgraner salvage, de totz ana drac. x; de mirra e aloen ana drac. v; alochil ana drac. xx; totz sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian mesclatz am aygua alichil o am album de huou si la compleccio del malaute es scalfada; e aprop usa de aquest emplaustre, quar es de bona composicio e restaura les osses trencatz leugierament, e confereys a motz homes. Autra manieyra de emplaustre le qual comfereys a fractura e torcio: recipe migrach e met de altea blanca ana drac. x; de mirra e de aloen ana drac v; de acacia drac. vi; de bol armenic drac. .xx. Mays si es scalfat, lahoras comfeys aquel am aygua de coliandre humit o am aygua e usa de lu.	May it be fractured? Then apply healing water from the columnar herb to that area." Autra manieyra de emplastra pus fort en resolucio que aquest primier, quan accideys apostema dur deves la restauracio del membre: recipe de razitz de altea e de semensa de li, e de balaustia, e mellilot, majorana, flors de viol, de camamilla, de totz ana partida i engual; totz sian trissatz e sian cofitz am aygua de sauze o am aygua dousa o am vi, tot aquo segon la qualitat del membre e le repaus de la color de lu.	Otherwise in the plastering of pus strength for this first resolution when an abscess lasts longer than you should restore the limb: recipe from alder and spargel, elderberry bushes, broom, marjoram, flowers of violet or chamomile, calendula petals or garden marigold; all shall be threesome mixed together with water drawn twice at dawn (or morning) before midday after sunrider, according to the quality of the limb and healing water color." This intricate remedy reflects medieval medicine's complex approach to treating infections like abscesses. The text outlines a procedure for creating an antimicrobial poultice from various plants mixed with specific waters drawn at dawn, adjusted according to the patient’s limb condition and the healing properties of water sources (such as well or springwater). This conveys not only how medieval physicians sought natural remedies but also their understanding that treatments needed to be tailored individually. The use of specific colors in poultices suggests a rudimentary knowledge of pharmacognosy—the study of medicines derived from plants, with color believed to influence healing properties differently.
Mays Ypocras no diyssec en le sieu libre que sia pausat sobre le membre trenquat deves la restauracio de lu sino cerot fayt de cera e de oli e no autre causa; e recomtec que sia migier entre grossitut e subtilitat. Mays la quantitat segon la qual cove que romangua la liadura e aprop sia disliada, es que consideres si no es accidit dolor ni pruziment ni le os es trencat no es maugut de son loc, lahoras tu no deslies de motz jorns. E si no accideys al membre alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no deslies aquel sino aprop tres dias o quatre o v o vii; e alcunas veguadas tot aquo es layssat per xx dias segon que a tu appar per la desliadura del membre, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que la fractura adhereys, e se acosta a la coagulacio de la carn sobre aquel. E lahoras ajusta en la strictura mays que en la tua strictura primieyra tota, e ayusta en la engrossacio de la vianda del malaute, segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu. Mays si tu vezes le loc de la fractura ja desiccar e extenuar mays que no cove, lahoras sapias que·l nutriment es prohibit pervenir ad aquel; e donc embroca aquel am aygua tebeza deves tota veguada que delias aquel; e sia aquo en totz tres dias; e alleuja la strictura un petit, e per aquesta operacio corr al membre le nutriment, e es sanat leugierament.	May you find the fracture site dry and flaccid at times so that it does not swell, provided you know wisely that food is prohibited for this to prevent such; therefore embrace water in dew form as a substitute throughout your daytime intake of these things. Take care with pain every three days using only a small amount; through which the constriction will be released and nutrients are directed back into the limb, thereby healing it!
Mays aquo que fan les fols restauradors de la fractura del membre autra veguada quan no es restaurat al comensament, segon que cove, e es restaurat segon tortuositat, es error segon la operacio de lor, e temor gran, e si fos dreyturier aquo agrandit les Antics en lors libres e agueran am aquo obrat.	May the water that healers of broken limbs use when not yet fully repain while following their prescribed method according to those who teach, and once it is restored as per shape (i.e., round), then using this will be wrong in accordance with their practice, inducing great fear among them; if done rightly, these waters would expand the Ancients' bodies freely when they drink it, showing increased vigor while working.
E yeu no he vist ad alcu de lor aquo far, per que es pus razonable que aquo no fassa.	And you have not seen from them how they make their water, for which reason it is reasonable that the water does not harm." (This sentence seems to express skepticism about a certain method or treatment involving "water," possibly related to medical practices of the time.)
Capitol segon: De fractura quan accideys en le cap.	Capital Segundo: When you injure your head.
Las specias de fracturas son motas, e las figuras de lor son diversas, e las causas son distinctas, quar de fracturas alcuna es fayta per percussio de spaza, e la percussio osta tot le os entro al ciphac, le qual es dejos le os, ayssi cum fay ayssa en le fust, e per aquo aquesta specia es nompnada ascial; o la spaza inscideys alcuna partida del os, e inscideys la carn de lu e no passa la inscizio entro al derier de lu; e aquesta specia de fractura es nompnada levatio absoluta. De restauracio del nas quan es trincat.	Of restoration of nose when it is broken.
Sapias que no es trencat del nas sino doas partidas ensemps pus sobiranas, o una de aquelas alcunas veguadas, per so quar en lu has dos osses, quar la partida dejos es cartillaginosa, e no es trencada e no accideys a lu sino atricio e tortuositat e sinuitat. Mays si es trencada la una de las doas partidas de lu, lahoras cove que tu intrometas le dit petit en le sieu nas, e que engualhas aquela fractura dedintz am le tieu dit indic, e am le dit pous defora, entro que retorne le nas segon la sua figura natural. E aprop entromet en la extremitat del nas una meca de drap de li, si la fractura es en una partida, o metz doas calguas, si la fractura es en doas partidas, e sia en la calgua grossitut de tanta quantitat que umpla le trauc del nas. E diysso alcus dels antics restauradors que las calguas sian enfundudas en boder, e sian permudadas en tot dia, mays no es vist a mi; habantz cove que la meca sia enfunduda en album de huou comfit am polvera de moli; e aprop layssa la qualgua entro que l’os sia fermat e sia endurazida la cartillage.	The ancient hernia treatments that the pins have been hidden in bedding, and which can be cleaned every day but are not visible to me; so I ask if you could wrap them in an album of comfits as it is polished with wax for better preservation. This passage suggests a rather elaborate medieval hernia repair treatment using metallic pins concealed within bed linens, which can be washed daily without being visible to the observer (the document writer). The request indicates that these old treatments are now outdated and possibly painful or unsightly for patients. It seems there is also mention of a specific method involving wax-polished comfits—likely an ancient treatment technique similar to modern hernia mesh repair but using different materials, reflecting the historical evolution in treating such conditions. The document writer acknowledges that they are not personally engaged with this practice since it involves wrapping objects within album leaves (a form of early book binding) filled
E alcunas veguadas sia entromes en le nas, en loc de calgua, pena de auca pus que es envolopada de drap de li leon; e sia que ja te la fractura del nas pus vehement e que le malaute no sia prohibit de inspiracio.	Even in some occasions she is found with a cold, located at the nostril'de place where you put your hand and clothed like an impaler; moreover her nose has been broken violently and that evil humors are not to be prevented from being inspired by inspiration.
E aquesta causa no es a tu necessaria; e si voles, fay aquo, e si voles, fay calguas.	This cause is not for you at all; if you want to do it, go ahead and make points or perform cauterization.
E si accideys autra veguada apostema caut, emplastra le nas am cerot o am coto enfus en vi agre e oli rozat, o am diaquilon.	If you suffer from other types of burns that require a poultice made with comfrey or hellebore crushed and mixed in oil rubbed on the nose, washed down by vinegar (water). This is an ancient remedy for treating burns. These herbs have been used since medieval times to treat painful conditions like sunburns caused by excessive exposure to heat from sources such as fire or light ray
Mays si no accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que emplaustres aquel defora am farina de sizami e am polvera de enses cofitz am album de huou; e aprop pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e no lies le nas am alcuna causa.	If you don't suffer from other types of burns that require treatment with poultice made from saffron and fennel seeds mixed in albumen spread on canvas (egg white), then cover your face after applying it, and leave the nose without any cause. This is an old-fashioned home remedy for sunburn or mild burns involving a paste applied to cool the skin and heal minor wounds through natural ingredients encapsulated in egg whites.
Mays si so trencats les osses del nas am fractura petita o so conminuitz, lahoras cove que scindas sobre aquels, e extraguas aquels am insturmentz que conveno ad aquels; e aprop cos la scissura, e cura aquela am aquo que encarna e consolida, e am emplastres ad aquo convenientz.	If you break the bones of your nose due to a minor fracture or are compelled to do so by necessity, cover those specific areas with gauze and insert appropriate tools into them; then proceed as I describe for that particular opening (fracture), healing this water-containing body part (nasal cavity). This is an instruction from the medieval period describing a first aid technique involving immobilization of nose fractures, potential wound care with saline solution to maintain moisture in the nasal area and dressing as needed for proper treatment. The reference may also hint at practices such as rinsing out blood clots or applying wet cloths that were believed to facilitate healing by keeping a specific body part clean and hydrated during recovery from trauma like facial fractures.
E si accideys plagua dedintz le nas, lahoras cove que cures aquela am calguas e administra canulas de plom entro que sia de tot sanat.	If you find that a patient has their nose broken, then heal him carefully and treat his wounds with iron-tipped needles so as to restore health in total.

De restauracio de la mandibula quan es trincada.	The second phase of jawbone repair when fractured.
Quan la mandibula dejos es rompuda e la fractura de lu no es am plagua, reguarda lahoras si la fractura es deforas tant solament, e no es trencada en dos e es curvada a las partidas dedintz, lahoras la sua cognicio es leugiera.	When the jawbone breaks and is not displaced (meaning it does not move out of its original position), apart from being fractured but just misaligned to some degree without forming into fragments, one should consider that such an injury may result in a minor luxation. The patient's understanding level must be taken into account accordingly for appropriate care and communication.
E cove donc, si la fractura es en la part dreyta, que tu intrometas le tieu indic senestre en la boca del malaute; e semblantment si la fractura es an la mandibula senestra, lahoras intromet le dit indic de la ma dreyta; e impelleys am aquel la gilbositat de la fractura dedintz am facilitat a las partidas defora, am la tua autra ma de la partida defora del os; am aquel decentment equa aquelam.	If the break is in any of the third molars (wisdom teeth), then insert your left index finger into the patient's fractured tooth socket, and similarly if it occurs on the right mandibular side, put the corresponding reference marker there; this will facilitate reduction before healing outside the bone. In such a case of dislocation ensure that you achieve an equal effect in both directions for proper management
E si la fractura de la mandibula ja es separada en doas, lahoras cove que administres extensio de doas partz segon rectitut entro que sia possibla la equacio de lu.	If the jawbone is already dislocated into two parts (implying a segmental fracture), provide appropriate extension of both segments inside so that equilibrium can be established, as this will facilitate healing outside the bone within an ideal treatment protocol for optimal recovery with minimal complications.
E si accideys conmocio de dentz a disrupcio, lahoras strenh aquelas de las quals speras que romandran am fil de aur o de argent o de ceda; e aprop pausa sobre la mandibula trencada cerot, e aprop pausa sobre lu drap duplicat, e pausa sobre le drap gran stelha decentment fayta, o una pessa de sola engual a la longitut de la mandibula; e aprop lia aquela desus segon que a tu es apparelhada la liadura de lu e que conveneys la applicacio, entro que no es destruida.	If teeth are lost due to disruption of their support in the jawbone (indicating avulsions), then provide immediate measures for those from which you hope that a root or crown will regrow towards gold, silver, or bone; and similarly apply pressure over the broken mandible as well as twice duplicated sheets of cloth on it, pausing with one finger along its length only once without causing further harm. Ensure to give priority treatment based on which ligament is prepared for support in case you have an appropriate bandage ready that conforms correctly and comfortably to cover the injury; this will help prevent additional damage while supporting healing from multiple perspects within a comprehensive dental trauma management protocol, emphasizing rapid intervention.
E comanda al malaute que use de repaus e tranquilitat, e pausa la vianda de lu sorbicios leons.	And command that the devil uses rest and calmness; pause his meals from lion'deeds of consumption.
E si extimas que ja es alterada la figura en alcuna manieyra, lahoras tu te coyta e deslia aquel al tertz dia; e aprop rectifica aquo que ja es alterat de lu e emplaustra aquel am polvera de moli, am album de huou, o am farina de cisami, pus que tu auras ostat le cerot de lu, e pausa sobre le emplastra lana leon.	If excessive cold that has already altered the patient' endurance in some way, you should apply and loosen such as this third day; then rectify what is already changed from him/her and reposition his/her limb under oil (or warm ointment), bone meal or wheat flour. You must also cover it with heated woolen cloths to keep the body temperature up, which helps in treating inflammation as well by reducing pain:
E adonc cum sta annex e ajustat aquel emplastre sobre lu, e la disposicio del os no es alterada, layssa aquel, que no le deslies entro que sia sanat e strenh la fractura; quar motas veguadas aquesta fractura es streyta en tres sempmanas.	And then when that annex and bandage is set upon it, so as to not alter the position of the bone, provided also that no metal object enters inside which would heal both painfully and strongly cracked fracture; often this fracture was tried in three months.
E si autra veguada accida apostema caut, lahoras administra aquo que havem dit motas veguadas en la sedacio de lu entro que sia sanat, e sia remaugut aquel apostema.	And if another week occurs with an abscess developing, then give the same water that was mentioned for frequent applications during past weeks within the wound's cavity so as to heal both internally and externally; also this will help in resolving such apesum (abscess).
E si la fractura es am plagua, lahoras considera si es pessa del os separada o satagias, lahoras tu te subtilia que ostes aquelas satagias am aquo que conveneys ad aquo en la remocio de aquelas dels sturmentz.	And if the fracture is in children (i.in young bones), we consider whether it's due to separated parts of the bone or slipped out pieces; carefully remove those slipped-out bits and apply that water which was previously mentioned for dressing during treatment periods, especially when dealing with skeletal fragments from fractured limbs (sturments).
E si le orrifici de la plagua es streyt, lahoras tu le amplifique am le fleubotomi segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And if the child's wound is bleeding profusely (streyt), then apply pressure with a bandage according to your need for hemorrhage control, ensuring not too tight which might cause additional problems due to circulatory obstruction in such delicate patients.
E aprop quan tu auras ostat aquelas satagias, e de aquelas no sira remaugut re, lahoras tu cos le orrifici de la plagua si es ampla; e sino, pausa sobre aquela un dels emplaustres que conveneysso ad aquo e encarnan aquela, entro que sia sanada.	And when you have removed all the slipped-out pieces (satagias), and for those not, after having applied pressure internally which helps in controlling bleeding; then cleanse that wound of a child if it's open wide as necessary to facilitate treatment. If instead, there are no such injuries but rather an internal one needs attention: stop what you have started (cleaning or treating the external injury) and apply pressure internally where needed so that bleeding is halted while awaiting appropriate medical intervention for healing purposes; otherwise keep applying a clean dressing externally on wound, ensuring it's properly encapsulated within its covering to foster an optimal environment conducive to recovery.

De restauracio de la furcula quan es trinquada.	The attempted translation of this medieval medical treatise fragment into English might read: "In the restoration of the collarbone when it is fractured." However,
Motas veguadas es trencada la furcula de la partida denant deves le muscle, e aquela fractura es fayta en una de tres manieyras.	Continuing the translation into English: "Motions that are habitually broken bones of a party occur due to certain muscles, and this break is formed in one of three ways." The medieval text suggests regular occurrences leading to fractures (likely common activities or injuries during those times) and identifies these incidents typically affecting specific body parts. Quar o es trencada, o seperada, o es seperada en doas partz otra que no accidan satagias; e es leugier a la restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que accideysso en lu satagias, e es dificil a restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que la fractura es am plagua.	Continuing with the translation of this excerpt: "When broken or separated, it is often done by one who does not have skills in healing; therefore, neglects its restoration and becomes difficult to restore for him; or when fractured like a child." This passage from the medieval treatise touches on aspects related to bone repair. It indicates that some injuries are treated poorly due to insufficient medical expertise at the time—highlighting an aspect of historical medicine dealing with its limitations and societal factors influencing patient care, particularly in pediatric cases where healing may present different challenges or necessitate alternative approaches not commonly known today.
E la operacio en aquela, quan la fractura es ses plagua, es que tu fassas esser present dos ministres, per so que la un tengua le adjutori e siegua la furcula trencada, e l’autre extenda le col ves aquela partida.	Continuing with the translation concerning childhood bone fractures: "In that case when a child's break is treated by making it so as to have two ministers; one holds his assistant in place and supports the broken collarbone, while another extends the leg over for her." This fragment of text outlines specific procedures thought necessary when treating pediatric fractures. It mentions using support from multiple individuals—the patient's helper (assistant or bystander) plays a role alongside medical professionals in managing such injuries at that time, suggesting an intimate community involvement within medieval healthcare practices and the particular vulnerabilities of children as patients
E aprop enguala la fractura am les tieus ditz entro que sia fayta la forma de lu segon que cove, e no sia en lu eminencia pauca ni concavitat.	And if there is an injury to the bones that are inside where it hurts according to its form as I describe and which does not stand out much nor have a shallow hollow, then we treat them with restoration of humors using medicines like wine or oil mixed well in water.
E si indigeysses mes de extencio, lahoras cove que pauses dejos le titillic del malaute spera de drap o de lana, e sia la grandesa de lu segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat; e exten e eleva la furcula e coarta la spera am la tua ma entro que enguales la frectura segon que cove.	If you are indifferent to extension exercises, then let me introduce the method of drawing out impurities with a cloth or wool as per your need for time; raise and extend the knee joint, flexing the hip so that we treat fractures according to what I describe how.
E si no podes atirar la extremitat de la furcula a las partidas defora, per so quar es pervenguda al preon, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e pauses sobre le muscle de lu un coyssi migier en grandeza.	And if you cannot throw the extremity of the knee joint outward beyond its parts, then it is because there are impurities at work; let me introduce that we treat with a towel or wool as per your need for time so that the disease may be turned upside down over the patient's head and rested upon their neck muscle while treating one hernia moving in size.
E le ministre prema le muscle de lu a las partidas dejos entro que l’os de la furcula sia elevat que es en le preon en sus, e lahoras tu rectifique la fractura e enguala aquela am les tieus ditz.	And the minister treats directly to the patient's muscle at the joint parts leaving that the bone of the knee is elevated so as not to be in front but behind, and I correct this fracture and treat it on those same places where you entered them.
Mays si sentes satagias de la furcula e so maugudas, lahoras cove que fendes sobre aquela e extraguas aquelas satagias am facilitat.	If at any time the bone of the knee hurts and you are not satisfied with its healing process; let me introduce that I treat directly to it, cut over those areas so as to remove old impurities which help in removing new ones for a faster recovery.
E si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu ingenia inscisio de lu am un dels inscissoris les quals has apparelhatz ad aquo, pus que havias pausat dejos la furcula le sturment que serve le ciphac; e es sturment de fust o de ferr del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	If it is retained in the bone, then your intelligence of this will allow one of these cutting instruments that you have prepared for it to be used, except when there has been a temporary pause on the shoulder joint which serves as an anchor; and its form is thus made from iron or steel:
E es semblant a culier del qual aquesta es la concavitat; e sia la sua latitut segon aquo que has necessitat de lu, segon la grandeza del os o la pauqueza de lu.	It resembles the convexity of which animal? According to need for it and based on the size or fragility of the bone:
Mays la longitut de lu sia segon que es a tu possible a la operacio; que haja doas extremitatz ayssi cum vezes, e la una extremitat sia ample e l’autre streyta.	May the length of it be as per your possibility for surgery? Ensure that both hands have at least one with a wide and unrestricted extension, and another is tied up tightly:
E si la disrupcio de la plagua la qual has inscidida quan has extraytas la satagia del os es ampla, e yest segur de apostema caut, lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura.	If the screw you inserted when removing bone is large and disruptive to blood flow in the joint (sic), make sure it's securely implanted with an eyebolt, then adjust both lips of the bandage as needed for surgical suture:
E si la disrupcio es pauca, o temes apostema caut, lahoras tu uemple la plagua am draps e pulvils segon la quantitat de la scissura de la plagua.	If the damage is minimal or you fear a skull fracture (sic), use bandages and pillows as needed according to the size of the head wound:
E si accideys apostema caut, lahoras infon drap en vi agre e oli rozat e vi, e pausa sobre aquel.	If there's an apical puncture (sic), put a wet cloth on and gently rub the area without stopping until bleeding stops:
Mays la strictura del os quan es ses plagua e ses seccio, es que pauses emplastre fayt de farina de moli am album de huou, e pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e aprop pausa la spera dejos le titillic de lu, si indigeyssas de aquela, e aprop pren humemate, so es torca la qual teno les Sarrazis , que sia mot longua, e sia latitut de lu de un palm o entorn aquel; e aprop pausa pulvils duplicatz sobre la stopa e l’emplastre; e aprop pren una stela de taula subtil de la qual la latitut d’ela sia de tres ditz e en longitut semblantment; e aprop envolopa aquela en drap, e aprop envolopa aquel drap am la stela en lo loc sobre le loc de la fractura; e aprop pausa humemati ayssi cum es revout, e revol aquela sobre le col de lu e dejos le titillic de lu sa e dejos le titillic de lu malaute, e reduzeys aquela sobre tota partida, e quan vezes que la strictura de la fractura am strictura descent, e es aquo que no es occultat sobre tu.	If there is a contracture of the bone when it has become soft and its section, then stop emplastrizing flour paste with wine extract from mustard seeds mixed with egg white, over which place cloth to cover this area; in addition also apply two layers of these preparations on that spot as well as underneath them.
E tot, que no sia mauguda la stelha desobre le os trencat; e per so cove que tu vejas le malaute quascun dia, que quan le liament es mollificat o vezas la stela ja esser remauguda, lahoras tu rectifica aquo e strenh la liadura.	E no matter if the bone is not crushed; and so that you see what happens to the humors each day when a ligament weakens or becomes more softened, then at some point correct this issue and restore its healthy tension.
E aprop pausa le dormir del malaute sobre le col de lu, e pausa dejos le titillic de lu deves le dormir de lu en la nueyt un petit coyssi; per so que am aquel sia elevat le adjutori de lu del latz de aquel, e donc es elevada la la fractura de la furcula a elevacio del muscle; o sia le bras de lu liat al col de aquel.	E apply the pillow of malaute to his back over your shoulder and place it there for him to sleep, then gently caress on that side so he may fall asleep at night with a small cushion; thus allowing aid from above to assist in lifting his body upward. This will result either in the elevation of the clavicle due to muscle contraction or by strapping him against someone else'nerving injury and immobilization.
E no deslies le liament si no accideys en le loc prusiment o apostema, entro a xii dias.	And if it is necessary not to loosen ligatures until there are signs of infection or decay at the site within twelve days. E dels accidentz de lu quan es trencat le mieg de lu es que declina a las partidas dedintz e accideys a lu gran dolor, e dificultat en lo hale, e tos, e fort leu e vomeys sanc; e es declarada en lu cavitat en le os trencat e no es occulta al sentiment.	Evil accidents happen when the night is broken and they decline towards parts of great pain and grievousness, causing difficulties in body, mind, and spirit, as well as weakened strength; it is declared openly within the fracture cavity where it cannot be hidden from sensation.
E la restauracio de lu es que sia resupinat le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa entre las spallas de lu un coyssi; e aprop prem als muscles de lu, e ajusta las costas de lu am las mas de dos costatz, e subtilia te en la operacio de lu e en la equacio segon tota manieyra que es ad aquo possibla e que conveneys ad aquo, entro que retorne la figura del os segon que cove.	The restoration of the body is that humors are placed above their two legs and a hernia between the shoulder blades; apply pressure to muscles below in order for movement upwards towards those areas, adjusting each backbone as many as two vertebrae, applying slight touch during the operation according to every possible way one can see it beneficial or necessary given these circumstances. In addition, return that body part second after healing is complete and his figure regains form.
E aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e estopa e pausa desobre astela de taula subtil de sauze o de caligi e de a lor semblantz en levitat, pus que tu envolopas aquela en drap; e aprop subtilia te en lian aquela sobre le os trencat que no sia maugut; e vay am liadura segon retonditat al dors alcunas veguadas, e strenh aquel am strictura decent; e aprop considera la liadura en tota hora, e quan es mollificada strenh aquela.	Apply pressure and bandage around the wound with dressing and gauze and apply an abdominal binder made of silk or linen that resembles a shroud; wrap it around him, ensuring nothing sticks out from underneath so as not to aggrade his injury. Additionally, lay gently on top of the fractured areas for several weeks according to proper alignment and apply firm pressure at those locations initially and gradually loosen that tightness when softened by time; always consider its position carefully during all times, and whenever it becomes more comfortable without needing continuous pressure be applied sparingly.
E si necessitat provoca a desliament de aquela deves corrossio o pruziment, o dolor, o apostema que accideysso en le loc, lahoras tu coyta e deslia aquela e erradica le emplastre e rectifique aquo que accideys per aquo am manieyra de curacio de lu; e aprop reduzeys le emplastre, si vezes ad aquo la facia; e ajusta a lu strictura entro que sia sanat.	E if it is necessary to cause the dismemberment of that which causes corrosion or inflammation in the location, such as pain, disease, or ulcer, and you take out the emplastrum and correct what worsens because of moisture management for healing; then reduce the emplastrum if it is exposed to the face sometimes, aligning strictly within which there can be cured.
Capitol .viii.	Capitulum octavi. (Chapter VIII)
De restauracio de las costas quan son trincadas.	Of course, we need more text from the treatise for a full translation and analysis of its contents on joint pain caused by cold humors in medieval
Sapias que fractura de las costas no catz sino en locs grosses que siegon le dos; e de las extremitatz de lor de la partida denant no accideys ad aquelas contricio sino per aquo quar so cartillaginosas. De la curacio de nodacio que accideys en le vestigi de alcuna fractura.	When you suffer from a kidney stone that has penetrated the bone of any injury, it is important to seek immediate medical care because this condition can lead to serious complications and requires prompt treatment which may include surgery or other intervent
Motas veguadas accideys aquesta nodacio en le vestigi de sanacio de fractura, e majorment que es prop de las juncturas, e es orrasada per lu la figura del membre; e fort leu prohibeys le membre de la sua operacio natural.	Often these kidney stones repeatedly cause pain at the site of bone healing, and they are most commonly found in joints where there is movement as this motion helps them to grind against each other inside; therefore we strongly prohibit any attempt for self-removal or manipulation.
Adonc considera si la nodacio es recent e aministra en aquela medicinas que han stipticat ayssi co es aloen, e enses, e mira, e sercacollo, e acrassia, e semblantz ad aquels; enayssi que prenguas de aquela alcunas o totas, e comfesiys aquelas am vi stiptic, o am album de huou, o am vi agre, e pausa aquela sobre la nodacio en estopa, e constringeys aquelas sobre lu per bona constriccio.	Admonish whether the nodule is recent and administer in that medicine which has stopped cough as well as fever, honey (or), myrrh, scammony, chaff seed, all of these to those who suffer from such ailments; soothing some or all with this herb therapy. Provide relief for the nodule on one'th side in linen and compress it tightly using appropriate constriction methods.
E leyssa extrictura que no deslies aquela per motz dias; e aprop deslia aquela e itera autra, entro que sia remauguda la nodacio; o strenh sobre aquela lamina de plom descentment, quar plom ha proprietat de remaure tot aquo que es imflat en les membres.	And in the extrusion that does not happen through a small crack for several days and then it repeats itself either above or below until the nodule is reduced; or if strong on that particular layer of metal, one descends with force upon it as though plumbing were used throughout this fluid within the body.
Mays si nodacio ja es en peyra convertida e streyta es e nessessitat provoca a ostar aquela coytadament, e lahoras scindeys aquela per la partida pus sobirana de lu, e inscideys la superfluitat e eminent, o ratz aquela am alcus rezoris entro que sia remauguda; e cura aquel entro que sia sanat. De restauracio de fractura quan es restaurada e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul no segon la sieua natura.	Restoration of the bone when healed, it returns itself as per its nature according to the soul'semuse.
Quan fractura de os es restaurada, e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul, lahoras aquo no es fayt sino per motas causas: de las quals la una es multitut de solucio del liament e de la liguacio de lu fayta no segon que cove; o per superfluitat de strictura dels liamentz entro que·l nutriment sia prohibit correr al membre; o per multitut de embrocaccio superflua; o per movement superfluent no en la sua hora; o per pauquesa de sanc en le cors del malaute e per debelitat de lu. E curacio de aquo es dar a mengar al malaute e far le cor de lu tendre entro que·l sanc sia multiplicat en lu; e aministra banh; e entromet gaug e leticia sobre lu. Then place pressure on the limb to make movement return through water flow in it: or continue with excessive wrapping of wet cloth over him until his nutrition returns and takes back its shape naturally; provided, that he is not bound too tightly so as to cut off circulation.

Mays you can see how the physicians and innkeepers have made their living here on our land, which is now considered unspeakably disgraceful because of those who died from it.
Mays si claudicacio e nodacio son recentz, lahoras cove que sian enbrocatz am aygua tebeza en la qual so coytas erbas mollificantz, ayssi cum son fuelas de altea e razitz de lu, e mellilot, e semblantz ad aquels; e sia fayt a lu emplastre am emplastre mollificatio ayssi cum dyallaquilon ben fayt; o que sia preza mucillage de razit de altea e sia contucida am gray de gualina o am oli de cirami, e sia emplastrat am aquel; o que sian prezes figuas grassas e sian trissadas am fems de colom, e semblantz ad aquels de las medicinas que son nompnadas amermans consolidacio. These should be applied for the same period that they are found in decoctions, using either a poultice made of these herbs moistened on cloth or ointment containing seeds fatty to fish oil. E alcunas vetz es dissolvuda am assidua fricacio leugiera que sia am las mas humidas, e sia administrat movement del membre a tota partida en totas horas. Translation: Some illnesses can be attributed to persistent exposure to the chilly draft from outside, which seeps into moist areas throughout the entire body during all hours.
Mays si tortuositat ja es anada denant e es fayta fort e convertida es en peyra e provocada es necessitat a curacio de lu am ferr, lahoras cove que sia le pus desus cecsat e la continuacio del os sia dissolvut, e sia inscidit aquo que superflueys de nodacio de aquel meteys am le os am inscissoris subtils, e sia aministrada facilitat en aquel am sollicitut e studi.	And if the tortuous shape is also a source of cold and turns it into stone which necessitates care for that limb with iron on fire to harden it so as not to dissolve pus outside the cavities, continuous bone loss occurs due to excess water from its bowels being poured over one's skeleton made delicate by sunlight exposure and study." Translation: If a deformity is causing coldness that solidifies into stone-like hardening of certain limbs (presumably affecting joint health), it becomes necessary to treat the affected area with iron heated until red hot, as this will not dissolve pus which may accumulate outside body cavities. De sermo en dislocacio.	The text "De sermo in dislocatio" is Latin for "On speech, into a
Dislocacio es eyssiment de alcuna de las juncturas del sieu loc, per que es prohibida de movement, e es orrezada la figura del membre, e fa venir sobre le malaute dolors e lesios grans.	Dislocation is an injury to one of the body's joints caused by external force applied that makes it unstable and prohibited from moving. It leads to painful sensations in the limb, often accompanied by severe swelling." Translation: A dislocation occurs when a joint within our bodies becomes displaced due to an outside impact rendering it immobile. This injury can cause considerable distressing symptoms such as acute pain and pronounced inflammation of the affected extremity or appendage.
Donc quan accideys ad alcu dislocacio, lahoras cove tantost perforsar que sia reduzit, e no tarde aquela reduzir, quar si es tardada, le loc es apostemat e fort leu am aquo es fayta dificil la reduccio de dislocaccio.	Don't when you injure with a fall, if the joint is so severely damaged that it must be reduced forcibly and quickly at once; otherwise, there will be an apostate location which becomes difficult to reduce such as in cases of dislocation due to injury.
E per aysso no cove que sia maugut ni stendut en la hora de la apostemacio, quar motas veguadas fa venir spasme e dolors ledentz.	Therefore do not leave it unattended or stretched out during the time of apostomation; otherwise, often comes a tendency to convulsions and painful sensations as if they would come themselves without any external cause.
Mays quan aquo accideys, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la flaubotomia del malaute, e aprop sia layssat entro que repause le apostema; e aprop le membre sia embrocat am aygua cauda e oli, e aprop sia reduzit am facilitat.	And when water injures you and it is necessary to perform the lavage of malady, let there be sufficient time for repose before returning again; then apply vinegar or oil on your joint as well as body parts that are twisted into a fist (wrapping), which can reduce them easily.
E tot membre sia curat am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra en son loc.	And all the member will heal with water where it is kept, and remembering its place in time (through proper alignment during immobilization or rehabilitation).
E yeu ja e ordenatz les capitols de dislocacio segon que es precedit en fractura; de la partida del cos pus sobirana entro a la partida pus dejos.	And in the treatment of joints, do as follows once it has been caused by trauma and bone fragments are separated from soft tissue (which would form purulent material). Then separate hard impure substance out to where the pure inflammatory exudate is located.

De curacio de dislocacio de la mandibula dejos.	Firstly, let's break down this text into smaller parts for understanding before translating it line by line from Medieval language with similarities to Latin and other Rom
So dislocadas las doas mandibulas si no tart; e la dislocacio de amdos es fayta segon una de dos manieyras: que o son remaugudas de lurs locs per pauca remocio, e so mollificadas un petit; o so dislocadas per entiera dislocacio e complida, entro que sian mollificadas a la partida de la junctura entro que corro saliva del malaute e que no puesca tenir aquela ni puesca claure la sua boca, e la lengua de lu sia envolopada en sa paraula.	In case of dislocated jaws if not treated properly; and the treatment for double mandibular dislocation according to one of two methods: that it is because they are remnaugued from their places with little movement, after which a small mollification occurs; or when dislocations occur completely, entering where both sides have been made soft at departure points through saliva and ensuring the patient cannot hold shut his mouth nor can he open it due to an enveloping of tongue in word.
Mays quan la dislocacio de lu es pauca, lahoras en las majors disposicios retorna per si an pauca causa.	If the mandibular dislocation is slight, it will return to its proper place on its own with little cause for concern and minimal intervention needed in major cases.
Mays si la dislocacio es entiera e complida, lahoras cove que sia administrada reduccio de lu leugierament, e no sia tardada de tot.	If the mandibular dislocation is complete and accompanied by fractures or other significant injuries; it should be immediately reduced using a lulgyeretion instrument without delay to avoid long-term issues such as malocclusion (improper bite) which may develop due to incorrect healing.
E es que·l ministre tengua le cap del malaute, e entrometa lo metge le dit pous de la una sieua ma en la razit de la dislocacio de la mandibula dedintz la boca de lu, si la dislocacio es de la una part; o que entrometa les sieus dos pouzes ensemps, si la dislocacio es de doas partz, e les autres ditz de las mas de lu sian defora am les quals enguale; e comanda al malaute que cesse las suas mandibulas e absolva aquelas anar de quascuna partida; e le metge engualhe la mandibula e enpellisca la mandibula entro que retorne al sieu loc.	The minister holds the patient's chin and meets with the doctor to discuss a plan of action for reducing one or both sides of the jaw dislocation, depending on whether it is unilateral (one side) or bilateral (both sides). If necessary, they should do so in turns; once agreed upon by all involved parties who have no objections remaining after each attempt. They command that the patient stop moving his/her mandibles and release them from any part where damage has occurred to allow for healing without additional injury or trauma. After consultation with a medical professional, they should then reposition the jaw back into place while ensuring it returns home safely following recovery periods after each reduction session; thus preventing potential misalignments such as malocclusion (improper bite) in future cases due to incorrect healing from previous injuries. This plan also seeks guidance and assistance, possibly with medical equipment or tools designed for this specific purpose if available within their resources at the time of treatment.
E si dificil es la reducio de lu, e majorment si amdos las mandibulas so essemps dislocadas, lahoras aministra evoporacio am aygua cauda e oli, entro que sia fayta leugiera la reduccio de amdos e no tardes la reduccio de amdos de tot, ayssi quo havem dit.	If it is difficult to reduce the hump and especially if both jaws are dislocated, administer a light poultice of water and oil into its bed because then reduction can be facilitated for both hips without delaying their reductions altogether; thus completing what has been said.
E donc cum retornam e so engualadas, e es clausa la boca del malaute e no es mollificada, lahoras pausa sobre aquelas polvils de drap am cerot, e sia fayt de cera e oli rozat; e aprop sia liat am facilitat am liamens mols.	And when they return and are put back together, the mouth of the malady closes and does not heal itself, so pause over those white flakes of cloth on its chest, apply hot wax or oil rubbed smoothly; this is for their ease to help loosen them.
E sia le dormir del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e·l cap de lu sia stant entre dos aurelhes, per so que no maugue aquel a la partida dreyta ni a la sinistra; e no li fassas per forsa masteguar alcuna causa; habans la sieua vianda sia forbicio leon, entro que quan las dolors sian remaugudas e las mandibulas so nozadas, lahoras maugue aquo que vol.	Let the malady rest on its back and ensure that the head of it lies between two pillows; this way we prevent it from being moved to the left or right side as well as avoiding any forceful manipulation aimed at causing a new dislocation, so long as food is not given until water boils with lemon juice within which time when pain returns and jaws are out of joint again then provide some cool drink.
E aquo sia aministrat am facilita, e no trebalhe sobre la apercio de la boca deves la comestio e beure e ocitatio, entro que la mandibula sia nozada e sanada.	And the water should also be administered for its ease and it must not move on the aperture of the mouth where food comes in to eat or drink until the jawbone is dislocated and healed; this ensures they are well hydrled without aggravating their condition.
E si es dificil la reduccio de duas mandibulas quan so dislocadas en alcuna hora e no so convertidas als lors locs, lahoras motas veguadas accideysso febres e soda assidua, e fort leu es alerguat le ventre del malaute, e fort leu e vomeys colera pura.	If it is difficult to reduce two dislocated jaws at any time and they cannot be converted back into their original positions when located then they are constantly annoyed with fevers that become hotter and more frequent over time, as well as severe abdominal pain which always affects the patient' endlessly.
E quan tu vezes aquo, lahoras sapias que es perdicio; e motas veguadas mor aquel al qual accideys aquo en x dias.	When you take that potion (or medicine), then know well what happens to your health; and if the sickness does not improve within ten days, continue with other treatments as prescribed by knowledgeable healers.

De la reduccio de la dislocacio del muscle.	This statement translates from Spanish and refers to the treatment of a muscle's reduction after it has become dislocated. Here is how you could present this

E la segonda es que sia dislocat a la partida desus del muscle, e aquo es fayt tart; e no es dislocat a las partidas detras per la spalla; e no es dislocat a las partidas denant per les nervis.	And the second is that it becomes dislocated from its usual place above the muscle, and this pain comes forth without reason: it is not due to being dislodged behind (by backbone) nor in front of by shoulder; nor does it result from nerves malfunctioning.

E fort leu accideys ad alcus homes percussio o cazement, e le muscle de lu es apostemat de apostema caut, e es cujat per aquo que ja sia dislocat. E la reduccio de lu es que·l ministre eleva la ma de lu a las partidas desus; e aprop pause les tieus pouses dejos le titillic de lu, e eleva la junctura am fortaleza en sus al sieu loc, e·l ministre eleva la ma de lu, e extenda aquela en sus; e aprop pausa aquela dejos quar ela retorna leugierament.	The reduction of the dislocation is as follows: The minister raises the leg to its parts above and then applies pressure on its joints in their rightful place, strengthening them back into position while he extends that part outward; after applying sufficient force for a moment, he returns it gently.
Mays si per aquo que havem dit no retorna, e so del comensament que accidic la dislocacio, motz dias, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia banhat en aygua cauda e sia aministrada enbrocacio que mollifique e liniesca ayssi cum si so coytz razitz de altea, e fenugrec, e melillot en aygua, e sia administrada.	However, if the dislocation does not return on its own accord and considering that this joint displacement happened over days or weeks because of an infection with a cold malady which is then treated by immersing it in warm water while applying linseed oil to mellow inflammation along with turpentine mixed with honey, flax seeds soaked in wine (fenugrec), and taken internally as well for overall recuperation. This holistic approach also involves administering these treatments according to the social norms or recommendations of that time period within a communal setting if needed.
E aprop le malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu dos e sia pausat dejos le titillic de lu espera de lana que sia engual entre levitat e strictura, e aprop le metge pause le sieu talo sobre la spera, e eleva le cap del muscle am vertut, e atire la ma del malaute per que no sia mauguda a las partidas dejos, e autre ministre tengua le cap del malaute, que no sia maugut a las partidas dejos, quar aquela tantost retorna al sieu loc.	Afterward, the malady is rested upon its thighs and held for brief periods while being massaged with linen to encourage circulation between levitation (elevation) and compression; concurrently a physician places their hand under the patient's foot applying pressure until they return it gently back in place. Another minister holds the head of the malady, ensuring that once its treatment is applied as directed hereinabove for alleviating pain at joint extremities with linseed oil and wine mixture to reduce swelling (fenugrec) along similar principles but now also applying honey mixed turpentine internally if necessary. Lastly, after such treatments the malady’s head returns back into its normal position by a minister; this indicates that once treated as described above it should return spontaneously without surgical intervention to correct dislocation.
E si voles, reduzeys aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu fassas esser prezent un home le qual sia pus lonc que·l malaute, e estia de la part de aquel latz, e entrometa le sieu muscle dejos le titillic del malaute e eleve le titillic de lu a las partidas desus entro que·l malaute sia suspendut en ayre, e autre ministre tire la ma del malaute de las partidas dejos del sieu ventre.	If you wish to reduce that second way according to this method: then make present a man who is longer than the louse, and he belongs to that place, and quickly introduce his muscle with touches of the louse and elevate it above its partitions inside so that the louse hangs in air, while another minister draws out the essence of the louse from below just after you have done this.
Mays si le malaute es leugier, lahoras cove que am lu que autre causa sia suspenduda, per so que grave aquel, quar la dislocacio retorna tantost.	If the malady is a lie (doubt), it must be that I learn what else might cause this serious illness to return as quickly as possible for its immediate treatment and prevention of recurrence through proper care, which involves understanding the exact causes in order to address them accurately.
E es reduzit eysament segon autra manieyra: e es que sia ficat en terra un fust lonc le cap del qual sia redon de figura, ayssi cum pilo de mortier, que no sia gros ni subtil, e aprop sia pausat dejos le malaute; pus que so pausatz sobre·l cap del fust draps leons, e·l malaute sia stant segon la longitut del fust, e aprop sia extenduda la ma de lu a las partidas dejos del autra part; e sia extendut le cos de lu del autre part am fortaleza, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	Alternatively, the method involves having someone tied to their feet on land with a long pole at the top which should be neither large nor subtle and must not slip from hands quickly; while also ensuring that when one is bound to the ground using blankets or sheets as ropes (sometimes called 'fust'), it shouldn't exceed two-thirds of its length, so that part where they are tied overlaps with another person’s area and thus fortifies their own position. This approach also ensures immobilization around halfway up the pole while someone holds them securely; furthermore, if this method is applied correctly along both ends, it significantly speeds up joint recovery as well stabilizes its healing process within a short period of time (efficiency). The goal herein lies in reducing pain swiftly with an efficient treatment aimed at restoring health while preventing future dislocations. This procedure requires careful observation to ensure proper application and understanding the precise nature, characteristics, or symptoms exhibited by each patient individually as some may react differently based on their overall constitution (humors). It is essential that a physician discerns these unique differences between patients in order to tailor an appropriate treatment plan. The efficacy of this approach lies within its ability not only alleviate pain but also promotes proper healing and prevention from recurrence through understanding the root causes, which are deeply interconnected with each individual’s constitutional balance or humors distribution throughout their body (medical philosophy).
E si es dificil reduccio de lu per totas las causas que havem ditas, lahoras usa de aquesta cura: e es que tu prenguas un fust la quantitat del qual sia en le lonc de dos brasses, e latitut de aquel sia de quatre ditz, e la grossetut de lu sia aleujat en le preon del tittilic segon aquesta forma:	If reduction of the swelling is difficult for all causes that we have mentioned before, then use this treatment as follows: and thus you must press a staff with length equivalent to two hand spans, breadth four fingers wide, at its tip pointing towards your chest' end according to the form shown here.
E aprop sobre le cap redon sian liatz drap leons per so que·l fust no ledesca le malaute.	And place layers of lions over his head, that the staff does not draw out the hernia.
E aprop sia pausat dejos le titillic del malaute, e sia extenduda la ma o le bras sobre·l fust entro a las partidas dejos, e sia liat le fust sobre le adjutori e le bras e la extremitat de la ma.	And hold the patient's chest still with layers of lions so that staff does not draw out hernia; and stretch the testicles or arms over half way, holding them on one side above where they should be inserted by means shown herein: position a cane vertically underneath it in between fingers spread apart (hereby referred to as 'dejos le titillic'), extend your hand with the chest so that its extremity is directly beneath this spot.
